Somewhere outside your safe nest there is a tasty cheese. The catch is that the stupid humans have not only placed it in a maze but also that the maze keeps changing. Nevertheless, you want that cheese, even if it means that you have to face dangerous traps. Beware, there are other mice in the maze as well and they may trick you to leave the cheese in their nests instead.

For each cheese that you take to your private nest, you score 1 point. For each cheese that you take to a shared nest, the players of the adjacent private nests score 1 point each. The player with the most points when all cheeses have been taken or no more actions are possible wins.

The game starts with 7x7 maze tiles, of which only the central one (the Cheese Chamber) is turned face up. The players start with 1 maze tile each. Each turn, a player does the following:

1. Move your mouse as far as you can along the path. In a nest, you may choose not to move, and in the Cheese Chamber, you may choose through which exit you move.
2. Move marbles as far as they can along the path. Marbles are traps that return mice to their nests and cause them to lose 1 turn.
3. Replace a maze tile anywhere in the maze by placing the one on your hand face up. If the maze tile you replace is turned face up, the next maze tile you replace must be turned face down.

When you leave the Cheese Chamber, you take a cheese, and when you enter a nest, you leave the cheese there, even if it is not a nest of your own. If you are hit by a marble, the cheese is left in the maze, and if you pass another mouse, you exchange whatever you carry. If you move out of the maze, you return to your nest and loses one turn while the cheese is returned to the Cheese Chamber. If the path is a loop, neither mice or marbles move.

The combination of free placement of maze tiles and forced movement through the maze creates a strong take that mechanism. Not only can you prevent other mice from finding the cheese but you can even force them to take it to your own nest. When you place a maze tile, each other player gets to place a maze tile so you must be very careful when moving in the maze!
186595.name: Mice in a Maze

186596.name: Lore of the Clans (V20)
186596.description:
From the back of the book:

Lore of the Clans includes:


The history, lore, and nightly practices of all thirteen Clans, told from the perspective of the Kindred themselves.
New combo Disciplines, powers, Merits, Flaws, and other rules specific to each Clan.
Revising and updating more classic Vampire: The Masquerade material to V20.

186598.name: Thievery
186598.description:
Thievery is a board game where players assume the roles of Spymasters in a fictional world where condemned souls are syphoned. This world is simply called "The Town" and every player participates in expanding it in order to take a piece for themselves... By force or otherwise.

As players expand the Town, they will claim special Territories as their own, which will later grant them advantages over other players. Some of these Territories will allow players to purchase enchanted weaponry, lethal skills, or even grant their owners an income boost.

The Town is expanded by each player with 3 different tiles - Roads, Markets and Buildings. These serve as space for the unit to move through and players to claim territory over (by placing faction-coloured territory cards over, directly).

Thievery, as the name suggest, revolves around coin management and manipulation. You can steal from enemy units just as well as you can steal from their lands. Your Thieves will help you with all your cunning needs, your Thugs keep the enemy out. And your Rogues, well... They specialise in keeping the enemy out of Town, permanently.

There are several ways to win the game. Either a player places all of their faction's territory cards, or they manage to capture all their enemies' territories before they can expand too much. Another way to win is to count victory points at any given time for claimed territories, recruited units and gathered coins.

186602.description:
Labels that fit on the Wooden Character Meeples (from the accessory by Mücke-Spiele) for Lords of Waterdeep

25 each of: Thief, Sorceror, Priestess, Warrior
(100 labels in total)
186602.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Labels for Character Meeples

186603.name: Star Dancer 3D Space Battles
186603.description:
Fight a campaign across the stars between various factions as they seek to conquer and rule the galaxy.

Gameplay:

Select your faction from one of 5.

Invite your friends or play against the AI.

Select your research focus (Economy, Defense, Firepower or Speed). Set your spaceship AI settings (weighted behaviours that affect how your ships fly and target enemies) Choose the planet you wish to invade. Enjoy the exciting action replay of the combat. And Finally, Go Forth and Conquer the Galaxy.

Source: The Game Website.

186604.name: Straima
186604.description:
Straima is an arena pulse-pumper platformer for 1-4 players, featuring a level editor.

Master over 125+ devilishly difficult levels in your ravenous pursuit of pinky delicacy, spanning game modes, selectable special powers and gameplay mutators. There's also a 2-4 player deathmatch mode and a full feature level editor with 60+ object types allowing you to design, save and share your inspired creations with chums for immense joy.

Source: The Developer Website.

186605.name: The Story Telling Game
186605.description: Once upon a time there was someone who loved telling stories... well if you know that someone, then they'll be a winner at playing The Story Telling Game! Whether they tell tall, short, fairy or scary stories, this fast-paced game will be a best-seller for children aged six upwards who have a vivid imagination, a competitive streak and are quick thinking. The Story Telling Game is a great birthday and Christmas gift and it not only encourages creativity, but it will keep children entertained on rainy days and school holidays. Created for budding Jackanorys, The Story Telling Game sees each player start with five words on their cards and when the clock starts, the first players starts telling a story using one of their words. Then it's the turn of the next player who has to incorporate one of their words into the former player's story... and so it goes on with each player adding to the story with one of their words at a time until the buzzer declares that it's 'The End' for the player who's talking when the buzzer sounds. When this happens, the player has to pick up all the cards used by the other players and begin a new story, this time with the opening 'Twice upon a time'. The story doesn't have to win awards or be a work of literary genius - it can be about anything but has to include one of the words on each of their cards. The Smiley Trump card adds a twist to the game as it can be used as any word and if a player is caught out by the buzzer, the Smiley Trump means they get off scot-free and the next player has to collect all the cards.

rpgitemversion: グローランサの忘れられた秘密たち
186606.name: Forgotten Secrets of Glorantha
186606.description:
Publisher's blurb

Enjoy the full transcript of the awesome Sandy Petersen seminar 'Forgotten Secrets of Glorantha' at THE KRAKEN 2014 with illustrations by Jon Hodgson.

186607.name: Otenki Kaeru
boardgamepublisher: トーホクウィステリア (Tohoku Wisteria)
186607.description:
User summary:
おてんきカエル (Otenki Kaeru) means Weather Frog in English. This game is designed to be played by a family who is new to card games.

Players are apprentices of the god of the sky who controls the weather. Their goal is to fulfill one wish, which is either children looking forward to a sunny picnic tomorrow or a frog waiting for rain.

They take turns playing one or more weather cards (sunny or rainy), while controlling their hands so that there is exactly one wish card in their hand at the end of round.

When the fourth sunny or rainy card is played, tomorrow's weather is determined and the round ends. They reveal their hands. If a player's sole wish card matches to tomorrow's weather, that player has fulfilled the wish and gains victory points printed in the wish card.

After several rounds, the player who has earned four victory points wins the game.

Publisher's summary:
親子や夫婦で初めて遊ぶためのカードゲームとして製作されました。
プレイヤーは天気を司る空の神様の見習いです。
他のプレイヤーとともに天気カードを出して投票し、明日の天気が晴れか雨か決めます。
ピクニックに行きたい二人の小学生と、雨を待つカエルの願いは、点数カードとして手元に届きます。
決まった天気に合った得点カードを持っているプレイヤーのうち、一人だけがその点数を得られます。
最も早く決められた点数を集めたプレイヤーが勝利します。

186608.name: Ferrum's Secrets
186608.description:
User Summary

You are investigating the appearance of a fog in the town of Ferrum and tracking down the mysterious disappearance of your grandfather, an electrical inventor, by going through the rooms of his house (and beyond). There are hidden object puzzles and matching puzzles as well as other minigame logic puzzles. There are also hidden collectables and different difficulty levels.

186609.name: Jewel Duel
boardgamepublisher: トーホクウィステリア (Tohoku Wisteria)
186609.description:
User summary:
ジュエルデュエル (Jewel Duel) is a 2-player game which is derived from Japanese traditional dice game チンチロリン(Chinchirorin) with magical flavour.

As a graduation exam from wizards' school, you have to gather jewels and forge miraculous rings from the jewels before your opponent does.

To collect a jewel, you roll three dice to determine the magic power and beat your opponents. A special effect is added if you roll a triple or a sequence.

Then you may transform three jewels of the same colour into a ring, or any three jewels into one jewel of your choice. If you have equal or fewer rings than your opponent, you may spend one jewel to conjure an elemental for a random effect. It may change the game drastically in your favour or your opponent's favour.

You win the game if you forge three rings first.

Publisher's summary:
日本古来のダイスゲーム「チンチロリン」をスタイリッシュにアレンジした２人対戦専用ゲームです。
魔法使いの卒業試験は、宝石を集めて奇跡を起こす指輪を作ること。しかし、同僚よりも早く指輪を作らなければなりません。
宝石を集めるために、プレイヤーは魔法を唱えます。何も難しいことはありません。魔法が込められた３つのダイスを振るだけです。ただし相手プレイヤーよりも強力な魔法、つまりは強い目の組み合わせを出さなければなりません。
相手よりも不利な状況にある場合、宝石を消費することで精霊を召喚することができますが、その結果もダイスの目次第。大逆転を呼ぶこともあれば、さらに窮地に追い込まれることもあります。
先に指輪を３つ作ったプレイヤーが勝利します。

186610.name: The Gray Society
186610.description:
Drakonheim: City of Bones Preview 1

From the introduction:

The Gray Society is a gathering place for necromancers, but they are not worshipers of a dark god or crazed wizards bent on world domination. They are intellectuals, driven by curiosity. They are fascinated by the gray land between life and death, and see the reanimation of the dead as the ultimate art.

186611.name: Knights of the Eclipse
186611.description:
Drakonheim: City of Bones Preview 2

From the introduction:

Despite all the efforts of the Gray Society, many in Drakonheim do not trust them. For too long necromancy and the undead have been a source of terror and the province of dark gods and demon lords. Most who feel this way simply avoid the Gray Society as they feel powerless to stop it.

The Knights of the Eclipse, however, are fighting back. Despite what the lord mayor and the city watch say, the abominations are evil and must be destroyed. The Knights of the Eclipse wage a crusade that started by attacking the skeletons and zombies that roam the streets at night. Twice now they have also killed minor members of the Gray Society.

186612.name: Little Grendus
186612.description:
Drakonheim: City of Bones Preview 3

From the introduction:

The dwarven kingdom of Grendus once thrived in the mountains west of Drakonheim. While nowhere near the size or power of the Cevali Empire, the ancient kingdom had a rich history and created many great works. It terraced large sections of the mountains for farming, and built great cities within the mountains themselves.

186613.name: Hobgoblin Lands
186613.description:
Drakonheim: City of Bones Preview 4

From the introduction:

The lands far north of Drakonheim are home to hobgoblins—the same hobgoblins that launched the recent failed attack on Drakonheim. While many died in the assault, plenty survived and fled back to their homelands, and those too young, old, or infirm to fight never left.

The hobgoblins who don’t live as raiders survive primarily as herders watching over flocks of goats or sheep. Their communities are called warclans, even when they are not at war, and they frequently fight against each other. They raid for food, wealth, and slaves; try to claim the best grazing lands; or simply go to war when one clan’s leader besmirches another’s honor. Historically, raiders preferred to attack non-hobgoblins, but most other races have either fled south or have already been utterly destroyed.

186614.name: Arclight Cascade
186614.description:
User Summary

You play a ball of light with a laser sword in a contained field. You can duel other players or work together against drones. The graphics verge on abstract and the music is 'late eighties' synth.

186615.name: Drakonheím: City of Bones
186615.description:
From the introduction:

Drakonheim is a fantasy city full of intrigue and surrounded by dangers. Goblins dwell in the sewers, undead walk the streets, and aristocrats scheme for greater power. Hobgoblins ride across the northern plains, lizardfolk rule the southern swamps, and all manner of monsters hunt in the western mountains.

Drakonheim is a system-free setting; you can use it with any fantasy roleplaying game. It can serve as a quick stopping point, or as the center of an entire campaign.

186616.name: Rats in the Sewers
186616.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Rats in the Sewers, the first chapter in the Heroes of Drakonheim trilogy. Heroes of Drakonheim may be played all together or as stand alone adventures. The adventure is set in the fantasy city of Drakonheim, which can be incorporated into any larger fantasy world.

In Chapter 1: Rats in the Sewers, the PCs are asked to solve a series of mysterious disappearances. They follow the trail into the sewers, find the goblins responsible, and learn that they are selling the bodies to a shadowy group of humans.

186617.name: Skeletal Society
186617.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Skeletal Society, the second chapter in the Heroes of Drakonheim trilogy. Heroes of Drakonheim may be played all together or as stand alone adventures. The adventure is set in the fantasy city of Drakonheim, which can be incorporated into any larger fantasy world.

In Chapter 2: Skeletal Society, the PCs discover that the group purchasing the corpses is a cabal of necromancers calling itself the Grey Society. In the process, the PCs may stumble upon a nest of wights, some of the Society’s headquarters, and perhaps a Society initiation ceremony. These encounters lead to a final confrontation with the leader of the Grey Society, who implores the PCs to end their grudge against them. The Grey Society is animating a host of undead to combat an even greater threat. A mighty force of hobgoblins and their allies are marching towards Drakonheim and without additional defenses, the city will surely fall.

186618.name: Defense of Drakonheim
186618.description:
For five characters level 3-5

From the introduction:

Welcome to Defense of Drakonheim, the third and final chapter in the Heroes of Drakonheim trilogy. Heroes of Drakonheim may be played all together or as stand alone adventures. The adventure is set in the fantasy city of Drakonheim, which can be incorporated into any larger fantasy world.

In Chapter 3: Defense of Drakonheim, the heroes must protect the city from attack. They have several days to prepare its defenses and seek out allies before the enemies reach Drakonheim. When the foes arrive, the PCs must attack key enemy units, trying to bring down the hobgoblin war chief who leads the attack.

186619.name: Blaster Shooter Gun Guy
186619.description:
User Summary

Super retro themed, this 2d platformer is also super hard, falling in the sub-genre of platform hell and drawing negative criticism as a result. The theme ranges from ninja to dinosaur to cute candy cane, but the platform to platform type of game remains the same. It features individualized characters for you to play, 50 levels, 7 worlds, and 7 bosses.

186620.description:
8 "carved bone" dice and their dice bag for The 7th Continent.

Separate add-on in the Kickstarter campaign.
186620.name: The 7th Continent: "Bone" Dice & Dice Bag

186621.name: Diadra Empty
186621.description:
User Summary

A shoot 'em up with a fantasy theme, but actually plays like the classic arcade game Defender. And like Defender, it's hellish to fight in two directions (even with a wraparound map in the corner) and like Defender, the opponents are colourful and varied. There are customizable weapons and the chance to ride a dragon to increase destruction.

186622.name: Hare in the Hat
186622.description:
User Summary

This is a combination of a point and click search and individual puzzles. The story aim is to unlock the trapped rabbit in a room by going through the room and solving puzzles in the correct order. There is an interesting guide that if used negates any further achievements and instead leaves the user with a "Cheater" achievement. This led to a lot of angry users which was only multiplied when the dev promised to provide an unlock in the DLC (which would have to be bought). The game can be completed quite quickly.

186624.description:
In Pacal's Rocket, each player build pyramids in the districts of the ancient Maya town Palenque. According to the dice roll of the actual round, the player moves his starship, a pipe. After the movement, a player may throw 1 energy stone of his own color into his starship and under certain restrictions another one into an opponent's starship. When starting the movement, any energy stones in the starship will stay on the board.

A player may build a pyramid if his energy stones are placed in a certain constellation on the board. In this case, he builds the pyramid and afterwards takes back his used energy stones.

For building a pyramid, the player gets victory points if he is the first builder in the district or gains the majority.
186624.name: Pacal's Rocket
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - Pacal's Rocket

186625.name: Snoopy Flying Ace Game
186625.description: The world's most beloved beagle is back! A legend in his own mind. Snoopy takes off as the Flying Ace in constant pursuit of his nemesis; The Red Baron. It's high-flying fast-paced fun around the Eiffel Tower as Woodstock and his team of mechanics lend support from the ground. Pick up the most tiles to win!.

186626.name: Chronicards: Les grandes inventions et découvertes scientifiques
186626.description:
Description
Ideal for acquiring a good foundation, The great scientific inventions and discoveries is for young adults, but also looking for a family game or a cultural product for easily dive back into discoveries.
Chronicards, a whole collection to mix !
Each card is unique!

Medal at the Lépine contest.

Contents
60 tarot cards formatted with instructions in French.

How to play ?

Chronicards is a card game played using 60 cards.
Each card depicts a great discovery or invention on one side with explanation and the year in which that event occurred on the other side.
Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is put in the right place and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.


Description
Conçu en collaboration avec des professeurs des écoles pour une utilisation parascolaire, ce titre s’adresse à un large public à partir de 10 ans.

Idéal pour acquérir de bonnes bases, Les grandes inventions et découvertes scientifiques s’adresse aux plus jeunes mais également aux adultes à la recherche d’un jeu familial ou d’un produit culturel permettant de se replonger facilement dans les découvertes.

Chronicards, toute une collection à mélanger !
Mélangez les thèmes pour enrichir votre chronologie. Chaque carte est unique !

Médaillé au concours Lépine.

Contenu
60 cartes au format tarot avec notice en français.

---

Comment jouer ?

-Preparation de la partie -
Distribuer 5 cartes côté texte visible devant chaque joueur sans retourner les cartes. Les joueurs laissent les cartes posées sur la table. Déposer la pioche côté texte visible et retourner la première carte du paquet côté date sur la table. C'est le point de départ de la chronologie.

-Déroulement-
À tour de rôle, chaque joueur choisit une carte dans son jeu en énonçant à voix haute le titre de l'événement. Il la positionne ensuite chronologiquement par rapport à celle(s) déjà déposée(s). Il retourne alors la carte côté date pour vérifier s'il a raison. Si oui, il ne pioche pas de carte. Si non, la carte est repositionnée au bon endroit dans la frise chronologique et le joueur pioche une carte. C'est ensuite au joueur suivant. Si un joueur ne se souvient plus de l'événement correspondant à une carte déjà posée, il peut la retourner pour la consulter.

-Fin-
Le premier à se débarrasser de toutes ses cartes l'emporte. Si des joueurs terminent dans le même tour, ils continuent à jouer en piochant une nouvelle carte et sont éliminés en cas d'erreur. Le dernier encore en jeu gagne.

186630.name: Zombies: A Hunter's Guide
186630.description:
The dead have always stalked the dark corners of the earth. Since World War II, the number of zombie outbreaks has increased every year, while governments desperately try to cover up the facts. Zombies: A Hunter's Guide contains all of the information necessary to recognize and combat this growing threat. Beginning with an explanation of the historical origins of zombies, it follows their history straight through to the threat they pose to the world today. All varieties of zombie are catalogued and examined, giving their strengths and weakness, with a special emphasis on recognition and elimination. Finally, the book covers the tactics and equipment used in zombie fighting. Accompanied by numerous full-colour reconstructions to help with identification, this book is a must for anyone on the frontlines of the Zombie Wars.

-Publisher's description

186631.description:
In Halloween, players play the role of dark lords recruiting minions across a graveyard. Whoever recruits the best army of undead will win the game.

MATERIAL

- 80 counters (headstones) in 4 colours (20 each of red, blue, yellow, green).
- 4 dark lords (red, blue, yellow, green)
- A deck of 36 mini-cards with the following structure:

-- The back of the cards shows a closed grave. There are 4 colours of graves (9 each of white, gray, black, brown).

-- For each grave colour, there are these fronts: 2 zombies (4 points each), 2 skeletons (3 points each), 2 ghosts (2 points each), 3 will-o'-the-wisp (1 point each).

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

Shuffle the whole deck and place the 36 cards facing down forming a 6x6 grid. This is the graveyard.

Players take turns moving their Dark Lord and claiming graves. When claiming a grave, the card is turned facing up. Players can also use their will-o'-the-wisps to inspect unclaimed graves.

The game ends when all cards have been revealed. Each player then adds up the value of his claimed cards. The highest score wins.
186631.name: Halloween

186632.name: Vampires: A Hunter's Guide
186632.description:
For centuries, vampires have lurked in the shadows, preying upon the weak and defenseless. Now, with world population centers booming, the vampires have found rich new hunting grounds. But help is at hand, Vampires: A Hunter's Guide contains all the information necessary to recognize and combat the growing vampire threat. After exploring the origins of these dark and terrible creatures, it examines the numerous vampire species and subspecies that exist around the world today. Focusing on the hunters' weapons, tactics and skillsets, this book provides information on identifying and eliminating vampires, noting the best practices from the secretive, powerful and dedicated hunters from around the world, and throughout the ages. With full-color illustrations of predator and prey, this is the ultimate resource in the fight to save humanity from the vampires.

-Publisher's description

186633.name: Fighties
186633.description:
User Summary

The cutesy characters hide that this is a difficult platformer that is fast and unforgiving. Besides playing against AI, there are multiplayer and co-op features. There are 25 characters to choose from but with lots of patches being added, there could be more at the time of reading this. There is a Linux version also in the works.

186634.name: Fitz the Fox
186634.description:
User Summary

Made to resemble handheld games from the late 1900s, this game uses only 4 colours. There are three boss fights and generally the game appeals to children but also adults in its difficulty.

186635.name: Flesh Eaters
186635.description:
User Summary

This retro-style game has you scramble to build barricades and develop weapons and skills to battle the zombies. You can select one of three roles (Medic/Engineer/Soldier) and use their skills to protect survivors. The game was still in rough stages in 2015 with the full patched version available by year end.

186636.name: Asylum: Within These Walls
186636.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within These Walls is a supplement for Asylum that has been kindly written specially for Greywood Publishing by the original author - Pete Lynn.

The Asylum is a horrific place; sparse, lonely, mind-bending and deadly. Enough, in fact, to send anyone spinning into madness. It has been home to the Hofas twins and their various followers for many years, but not all the secrets of the Asylum have been revealed yet and some lie completely undiscovered!

This is NOT a stand-alone product. This supplement adventure requires the QUERP Modern Core Rule Book and the original Asylum adventure to play.

186637.name: Bloody Basic: Weird Fantasy Edition
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
186637.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloody Basic takes the advanced Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing rules and boils them down to the essentials to make gaming easy, fast and fun.

The Weird Fantasy Edition rules are inspired by the wondrous prose and poetry of Clark Ashton Smith and Lord Dunsany and the art of such luminaries as Aubrey Beardsley and Sidney Sime. It include rules for the races, classes, spells and monsters of weird fantasy tales.

186638.name: Shadows in Focus: Sioux Nation - Counting Coup
186638.description:
From publisher blurb:

Running Into Danger

Illegally entering the Sioux Nation is hard. So is crossing the Sioux National Police. Doing both? That will earn you a good payday or a bullet in the head. But that’s the job that’s been offered. And what shadowrunner worth their mettle can resist the chance to make some powerful friends and even more powerful enemies?

Mika, a shadowrunner active on JackPoint, is hiring, and players have a great chance to make a pile of nuyen while showing just how much skill they have. They’ll have to move fast, stay alert, and make sure they hit whatever they’re aiming at. Just like they always do.

Counting Coup is an adventure set in the Sioux Nation and part of the Shadows in Focus: Sioux Nation series. It makes a great tie-in to that series, especially the Butte book, but it can also be used on its own. Counting Coup is compatible with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

186640.name: Demon of the Gibbet
186640.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cwizzikle the merchant must propose to his true love Nuisancia before the morning light, or she will marry Eggbert instead. But the merchant is delayed, and Nuisancia is in Tatherport, on the far side of the bay. The only road winds through the dark forest, and YOU must carry the message - past the haunted gibbet! Perhaps your first adventure will also be your last...

This solo is a brief starter adventure for novice characters only. Wizards may use a limited selection of spells. The adventure is compatible with all versions of the Tunnels & Trolls rules.

186641.name: Infinite Weapons 1
186641.description:
From publisher blurb:

What Sci-Fi is complete without some cool gear to play with. Well Avalon is here with a whole new series of gear books for IF 2.0. Inside you will find all kinds of cool weapons to use in your game, so strap on your new toys and conjure the universe.

186642.name: The Palace of the Jewelled Menagerie
186642.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Remarkable Shelley Harlan, superhumanly precise editor for Faster Monkey Games, brings her own fiendish nature to the task of tormenting foolish players with the compact yet devious PALACE OF THE JEWELLED MENAGERIE. Originally created for the One Page Dungeon project, PALACE challenges players on multiple levels. The answers to this one aren't in your stats, kids...

186643.name: Friendly Fire Pack 10
186643.description:
Friendly Fire Pack 10 contains eight scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2015 Advanced Squad Leader tournament.

The scenarios are:

FrF77 - Ghostbusters by Mattias Ronnblom
Germans vs French, 7 June 1940
German assault with VP survival as the VCs

FrF78 - No Glory in War by Mattias Ronnblom
Germans vs Russians, 7 September 1941
German Combined Arms attack against Russian fixed defense.

FrF79 - Saving the Center by Mattias Ronnblom
Germans vs. Russians, 27 January 1942
Snowy meeting engagement.

FrF80 - Breaking Bad by Peter Struijf and Chris Mazzei
Japanese vs Dutch, 14 March 1942
Dutch attack in the Dutch East Indies with variable victory conditions based on prisoner count.

FrF81 - Across the Rio Grande by Martin Svard
Russians vs. Swedes, 16 May 1942
Swedish assault on a prepared Russian position.

FrF82 - Riders on the Storm by Peter Struijf and Chris Mazzei
Germans vs. Allied Partisans & Americans, 26 August 1944
German attack on Partisan positions with American counterattack.

FrF83 - Phantom Army by Mattias Ronnblom
Germans vs. Russians, 16 April 1945
Combined arms Russian attack featuring heavy armor.

FrF84 - Bazooka Town by Michael Koch
Germans vs. Americans, 30 March 1945
Exit VP VCs for the Americans vs. CVPs for the Germans

186644.name: Between Star & Void
186644.description:
From publisher blurb:

Learn the secrets of both Star and Void

Explore the worlds of the Star Knights and their hated enemies, the Void Knights. Discover clues about their ancient past, their tools, their philosophy, their martial styles, and their mysterious Meditations.

Contains rules for the following:

All the material on Star Knights and Void Knights from the Whitestar rulebook, including meditations, in one place.
Four new classes, including the Meditation focused Mystic, the ace Star Pilot, the versatile Alien Star Knight, and the half-class Way Adapt.
Over 20 new Meditations!
New optional rules for Star Knight martial styles and combat techniques!
Indepth look at the Void Knights and their terrible philosophies.
Rules for Corruption and falling to the Void, or balancing one's sanity as an Eclipse Knight!
A completely new optional system for Meditations that totally replaces the Vancian prepared system. Master new Meditation groups that contain permanent abilities for the character rather than memorizing different powers each day.
Conversion for fantasy systems such as Swords and Wizardry, Labyrinth Lord, and Adventurer Conquoror King allowing the classes to work in just about any OSR system!
New Star Sword variants, new weapons, ships, and gear for Star Knights!
Optional Reaction Roll system for White Star!

186645.name: Wereblooded
186645.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! Wereblooded Shows You Where the Were Is

Bite Me! Wereblooded presents the scions of natural lycanthropes and humanoids, designed by Ennie-award winning author, Ben McFarland. Although they lack their parent's lycanthropic gifts, wereblooded share a animalistic heritage while appearing mostly -- but not quite -- like their unchanging humanoid parent.

Truly windows to the soul, the eyes of a wereblooded reveal their bestial nature, though this subtle difference means many still manage to live hidden in larger communities or on the fringes of society. Denied this luxury, monstrous wereblooded bear the animal head of their lycanthropic parent's animal form.

A new race for your Pathfinder RPG campaign, wereblooded offer players and GMs a choice between a humanoid and a monstrous humanoid version.

Within the pages of Bite Me! Wereblooded you'll find:

A look at Wereblooded society, relations with other encountered races, their alignment and religion, reasons for adventuring, and possible names for male or female characters.
Three potential clans for Wereblooded of different stock: the cat-like felis, the wolfish lupis, and the bear-inspired ursus. Additionally, alternate racial traits, subtypes and geographical distinctions allow for further customizing of Wereblooded characters.
Race-specific favored class options mean characters may select alternative rewards when gaining new levels besides a simple hit point or a skill point.
For characters looking to temporarily take on a lycanthrope's hybrid body, the incantation of Claim the Ravenous Hunter’s Form provides a skill-based magic anyone can learn!
A pair of sample characters in both humanoid and monstrous humanoid versions, letting GMs scale the initial introduction of Wereblooded to their games as they see fit.

186646.name: Weremantises
186646.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! Weremantises is Guaranteed to Bug Your Players

Not all lycanthropes are soft, furry, and oh so romantic. Some are covered in spiky natural armor, with insectile mandibles capable of biting a head off—and with a temperament that makes the head-biting thing a genuine concern.

Bite Me! Weremantises is an 18-page supplement describing a race of shapechangers who transform from graceful, cultured people into giant, deadly, cannibalistic insects.

Bite Me! Weremantises Contains:

Rules for creating weremantis characters using the Bite Me! lycanthrope system, including new racial traits, archetypes, and feats
New weremantis spells (from bleeding strikes to ten-thousand bites), magic items (from abduction gloves to the mask of divine right), and equipment (from beetle powder to slaver's darts)
Details of weremantis society, a lycanthrope nation that can be incorporated into any campaign
Two completely statted (in both human and giant mantis forms) ready-to-use NPCs.

186647.name: Playing Lycanthropes
186647.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! Playing Lycanthropes -- Definitive Lycanthrope Guide

Bite Me! Playing Lycanthropes presents rules and advice for playing natural and afflicted lycanthropes in the Pathfinder system, as well as a new and customizable natural shapeshifting race balanced against other advanced races, all written and designed by two-time Ennie-nominee, Robert H. Hudson, Jr.

Everyone knows the story about the character that failed their saving throw and contracted lycanthropy, messing the whole game up. That's because they didn't have this book to help them! Written for players and GMs alike, this is the definitive work on the issues involved in playing and GM'ing for someone who howls at the moon, and how to work with them to create characters and storylines that mean when you tell your story about the guy that contracted lycanthropy.

The response will be "Cool! instead of "Oh man, I'm so sorry!"

A new race for your Pathfinder RPG campaign, natural lycanthropes, offer players and GMs a way to bring lycanthropes into their campaigns from the start without overshadowing other races, and the extensive discussion of potential issues and ways to handle them will help make games involving lycanthropes easy to run and play.

What You get with Bite Me! Playing Lycanthropes

Within the pages of Bite Me! Playing Lycanthropes you'll find:

A look at natural lycanthrope society, relations with other encountered races, a discussion of alignment and religion, naming conventions for the race, and reasons they go adventuring.
An advanced race that allows you to play as a natural lycanthrope of virtually any animal species, plus alternate racial traits, subtypes, and feats that allow for further customization of natural lycanthrope characters.
Race-specific favored class options for all player-oriented core and base classes to allow further customization when gaining new levels besides a simple hit point or a skill point.
A lengthy, detailed discussion of the issues involved in playing Llycanthropes -- natural or afflicted --and how to work with your GM and fellow players to make playing one a memorable, fun experience for all involved.
A detailed discussion of the issues involved in running a game where one or more of the players is a lycanthrope -- afflicted or natural -- and how to work with your shapeshifter players to keep your game on track, your sanity intact, and make certain that everyone remembers the campaign for years to come -- in a good way.
A pair of sample characters showing you the wide range of options available to natural lycanthropes, complete with plot seeds to allow GMs to insert them into a game with ease.

186648.name: Skindancers
186648.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash the Inner Beast with Bite Me! Skindancers

Bite Me! Skindancers presents a non-lycanthrope shapeshifting race with thematic and historical ties to lycanthropes for your Pathfinder game, designed by two-time Ennie-nominee, Robert H. Hudson, Jr. Superficially similar to lycanthropes in that they can turn into animals, skindancers lack the bestial rages and curse of afflicted lycanthropes, and the mystic resilience to injury and vulnerability to silver inherent to lycanthropes, trading them for unique abilities all their own.

Once allies, fiends, and loved ones of the natural lycanthropes, the Skindancers were cast out thanks to the machinations of dark power of madness and evil and move through the world seeking a way to reclaim that which they lost.

A new race for your Pathfinder RPG campaign, skindancers offer players and GMs a choice for a shapeshifting race that doesn’t come with all the same baggage that lycanthropes do.

Within Bite Me! Skindancers you'll find:

A look at skindancer society, relations with other encountered races, their alignment and religion, and reasons for adventuring.
Alternate racial traits, subtypes and feats which allow for further customization of skindancer characters.
Race-specific favored class options for all player-oriented core and base classes to allow further customization when gaining new levels besides a simple hit point or a skill point.
For characters looking for an invigorating change of pace, the Embrace, where they can shed their old race and exchange it for that of a skindancer… and a perverted version of the ritual, the Skinning, practiced by evil, twisted souls.
A pair of sample characters showing you the variations available with the race, complete with plot seeds to allow GMs to insert them into a game with ease.

186649.name: Archetypes
186649.description:
From publisher blurb:

Find the Many Beasts Within with Bite Me! Archetypes

Bite Me! Archetypes presents a number of character archetypes that provide class options for lycanthropic characters, their allies, and their adversaries. Headlined by the lycanthologist, designed by author Sean K Reynolds, the book contains over a dozen new archetypes, as well as a new cleric domain, rogue talents, and witch hexes.

Within Bite Me! Archetypes you'll find:

18 new lycanthrope-based archetypes, each of which suits a different core or base class.
5 new hexes and 2 major hexes for the witch archetype.

186650.name: Meat-That-Screams
186650.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! Meat-That-Screams will sate Your Appetite for Lycanthropes

"... and lead us not into temptation..."

A lycanthrope is a being of raw power -- and for some, "raw" is the key word. Warm blood dripping from its jaws, a were seems to grow in size, strength and menace. And always there's the ultimate temptation -- release his grasp on sanity and give in completely to his animal nature to gain even more power and be free from the pitiful restraints of "civilized behavior."

Bite Me! Meat-That-Screams is a 12-page supplement to the Bite Me! line of Pathfinder Roleplaying Game lycanthrope products available from Misfit Studios.

Bite Me! Meat-That-Screams Contains:

Sustenance Pool rules, giving lycanthropes a new source or strength to draw on
Meat-That-Screams rules, improving on the Sustenance Pool powers, but at a great price to the lycanthrope
Over a dozen new feats tailored to the Sustenance and Meat-That-Screams rules

186651.name: Werewolves
186651.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! Werewolves is Howling to be Unleashed in Your Game

The original weres!

Known to all as rampant killers, their uncontrollable appetites tied to the waxing and waning of an accursed moon -- but maybe a werewolf can be something else, something more.

Bite Me! Werewolves is a 19 page supplement describing a race of natural shapechangers fighting tooth and claw against their bad rep.

Bite Me! Werewolves Contains:

Rules for creating werewolf characters using the Bite Me! lycanthrope system, including new racial traits, archetypes, and feats
New werewolf spells (from call of the wild to wolf guardian), magic items (from grit of deadly bites to the wolf-calling totem), and equipment (from man feet to wolf whistle)
Details of werewolf life and society
Two completely statted (in both human and wolf forms) ready-to-use NPCs.

186652.name: The Gaming Guide to Lycanthropes
186652.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bite Me! The Gaming Guide to Lycanthropes Changes the Shape of your Game

Note that this work collects the following previously released Bite Me! PDFs into one collection (plus new content): Wereblooded, Playing Lycanthropes, Archetypes, Skindancers.

Bite Me! The Gaming Guide to Lycanthropes presents a wide variety of shapechanger content from a number of veteran and up-and-coming writers. Aside from plenty of suggestions and guidelines for Gamemastering both afflicted or natural lycanthropes or using them as player characters, inside these pages you will find a wealth of game mechanics to bring these creatures into your game with style.

Within Bite Me! The Gaming Guide to Lycanthropes you will find:

Numerous Alternate Racial Traits, Wereblooded and Minor Wereblooded Clan Racial Traits, and Favored Class Options that address how adaptable such creatures are.
Lycanthrope Racial Bloodlines to add new flavor to the Sorcerer class.
The Wereblooded, Monstrous Wereblooded, and Skindancer race options.
Nearly two dozen New Archetypes to help shake up existing classes with a bit of lycanthropic flavor.
A selection of New Equipment and Weapons designed for or of interest to lycanthropes.
Over two dozen New Feats, including those belonging to the new Lycanthrope Feat Category.
An arsenal of New Magic Items related in some fashion to shapechangers (and, in some cases, to those who would hunt them.)
A bevy of New Magic Spells, along with a number of New Hexes and New Rituals, to add a touch of magic into the mix.
A range of Sample Characters to highlight various new game mechanics and racial options.




A short story to help set the lycanthropic mood.

186653.name: Mission Silbenrätsel
186653.description: One day, a safe suddenly appears in the castle ruins - but what is the code to open it? Luckily, the four amateur detectives keep on finding cards with pictures on them on their way through the city, which lead them to the code numbers. How is it done? Think of a word that describes the card and break it down into syllables in order to move the figures. Crack the code with a sharp mind and a feel for language!

186654.name: Miravlor Fantasy Role-playing Game
186654.description:
User summary:

Miravlor is an ambitious role-playing rules set presented as numerous downloadable MS Word "DOC" files, including:


How do I play?
Frequently asked questions
Introduction to Miravlor
Heroes and anti-heroes (classes)
Spiritual allegiances (belief systems)
Basic rules for combat
Character customization
Weapon charts
Equipment prices
Skills
Denizens of Miravlor (monsters and NPCs)
Animals
Magic
An invitation to the advanced game


The referenced "Advanced Game", alternately called the "West RPG", was a work in development that apparently was never published. The materials suggest the game is intended to be multi-genre but the presented rules are definitively in the fantasy realms.

Generally, characters have Attributes, Class, Levels, and Skills. Character building is very complex but somewhat more flexible than similar class/level systems. Likewise, combat and magic also are quite complex. While the introductory materials invite new players to utilize the system, the actual rules suppose a reader quite familiar with standard role-playing methods.

186655.name: Mirima Tyalie
186655.description:
User summary:

Mirima Tyalie is a concise role-playing system that presents a simple core mechanic and several optional rules. The intent is to allow the system to be highly flexible. For example, a psionics and a magic system are provided as options. However, these systems are not usable "out of the box" and would require expansion prior to campaign use. Characters are built using either random process or point pool purchasing.

The core mechanic involves characters rolling a dice pool of d10 based on Skills, and attempting to "roll under" the rating. The GM rolls a similar dice pool based on Difficulty, and the rolls are compared. Skills advance through use. Combat is handled the same way, though optional rules add armor, damage reduction, and various damage types.

The game was intended to be expanded with various genre-specific supplements.

186656.name: Chatty Games
186656.description:
Contains board with 2 sides for 2 different games to play "with" your Charmin' Chatty Cathy doll: Chatty At The Fair and Chatty Skate 'N Slide. Includes a record to insert into the Charmin' Chatty doll so she talks during the game. (Child can play games alone & doll can be the second player, or up to 4 players can play)

The first game is Chatty Skate 'N Slide: Play this game with the skates attached to the playing pieces and use side 1 of the record. Begin on the Start space, Chatty moves first. Pull the Chatty-Ring all the way out and let go. Chatty will say "Race to Orange", "Move ahead to Yellow", etc. Player will go to the next space of the color indicated. If Chatty says "Race to Orange and Slide", move to the next space of that color and use the slide if there is one. You cannot use the slide if Chatty does not say so. If Chatty says "You cannot move!", you cannot move on that turn. The winner is the first player to get to the winning "End" circle. Chatty must call one of the colors in the circle: red, orange, yellow or green, whether she says slide or not.

The second game is Chatty At The Fair: Use the playing pieces without the skates and use side 2 of the record. Child starts on My Start space and Chatty starts on Chatty's Start space. (When 3 or 4 play, 2 start on My Start and the rest start on Chatty's Start) Pull the Chatty-Ring all the way out. She will say HOW TO TRAVEL to the World's Fair. ("Why not ride the Pony?", "Go take the Whirlybird", "Go by Choo Choo Train", "Get in the Car and go", "Take the red Ferryboat", or "Take the Jet Plane - zoom!") Move to the next picture on the players path that matches what Chatty says. If Chatty says "Stop to see the sights", player does not move. If Chatty says "Green Light, go ahead 3" player moves ahead 3 picture spaces. Winner is the first player to get to their winner space (Whirlybird for My Start path and Choo Choo train for Chatty's Start path) (If player is 1 to 3 spaces from the winner space and Chatty says "Green Light, go ahead 3" player moves to the winner space and wins.)

186657.name: League of Mermaids
186657.description:
From the creators of the award-winning Atlantis: Pearls of the Deep and Legends of Atlantis: Exodus comes the next big underwater Match-3 game, League of Mermaids! Help League members - Cora, Mishell, Koh, and Marina - on an epic quest to save their endangered mermaid homeland from destruction! League of Mermaids combines Match-3 gameplay with realistic physics to create a uniquely fun gameplay experience.

Over 60 levels of Match 3 + Physics puzzle fun!
Use multiple strategies and brilliant power-ups to clear pearls and earn achievements!
Beautiful hand-drawn artwork that brings the League of Mermaids to life!
Unique Bottomless Trench and Zen Pearls mode for unlimited replay value!

Source: The Publisher Website.

186658.name: InfiniTrap
186658.description:
Greetings fellow Adventurer, I'm Ohio Jack. The second-best Treasure Hunter in the world! I have been on a restless quest for The Cup of Eternity for quite a while now. After a long search for proof of its existence on Reddit and Google, I could finally gaze upon the arcane treasure in a deadly dungeon riddled with fatal traps.

I ask for your help to stay alive on this treacherous journey for the Cup of Eternity.

Game Highlights

20 challenging levels
A full-featured level editor
Custom levels support
Gamepad support
The game is HARD :)
Linux, Windows, OSX, Android and iOS.
DRM FREE.
Free life-time updates

Source: The Game Website.

boardgamecompilation: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Satellites & Super Weapons Mini Expansion
186659.description:
This Kickstarter-exclusive edition contains, in addition to all the contents of the base game, the mini expansion "Tiny Epic Galaxies: Satellites & Super Weapons Mini Expansion".

From the description of Tiny Epic Galaxies:

A thirty-minute game of galactic conquest, Tiny Epic Galaxies is driven by an exciting dice-rolling mechanism that rewards thoughtful programming of the results. Players control a home galaxy and a fleet of space ships. As players upgrade their galaxies, they gain access to more ships and more dice.

Each turn, a player rolls a set of dice; how many dice are rolled is determined by the level of that player's galaxy. Each side of the six-sided die represents a different type of action: Movement, Colony Action, Harvest from Culture Planets, Harvest from Energy Planets, Improve an Economic Influence, and Improve a Diplomatic Influence.

After the roll, the player sorts the results of the roll (one selective re-roll is allowed) and organizes the dice in a desired activation order. Each die, in order, is then resolved and the results are immediate, which allows the player to pull-off unseen combos and surprise other players. Other players have the option to copy other player's actions...at a cost!

As players expand their galaxy by colonizing other planets through economic and diplomatic influence, they gain victory points AND the special powers brought in by those planets! In addition to galaxy upgrades, effective resource management provides luck-mitigating options that can sway the game in a calculated player's favor.

Whoever achieves the most points from acquiring planets and upgrading their personal galaxy wins!
186659.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies Deluxe Edition

186660.name: Anoxemia
186660.description:
User Summary

The plot is that you, Dr. Bailey, have been given a mission to bring samples from the ocean floor, but your submarine crashed and you are left with few oxygen supplies and a temperamental operation droid. You collect oxygen and supplies while taking samples, avoiding acid and ocean mines. The plot grows ominous as the story progresses and making progress becomes hard as the dangers and puzzles to solve increase.

186661.name: Werewolves: A Hunter's Guide
186661.description:
Fear the full moon; for on that day of lunacy the wrath of the werewolves is unleashed. For thousands of years, from the depths of the dark forests to the dimly lit city streets, these beasts have stalked us from the shadows. This book is the only thing standing between humanity and an overwhelming horde of lycanthropes. It reveals the huge variety of werewolf types, including viral, shamanic, and sorcerous, highlighting their strengths and weaknesses, and explaining the best methods to capture or kill each variety. It also tells the full history of werewolves and the shocking role that they have played in some of history's most significant events, especially their involvement in numerous wars. Finally, it covers the groups and societies devoted to hunting the creatures, whether for safety, study, or sport.

-Publisher's description

186662.name: Knights Templar: A Secret History
186662.description:
Born in the dark days of the great crusades, the warrior monks of the Knights Templar vowed to defend pilgrims traveling to the Holy Land. Yet strangely, there are few historical records of the Templars ever fulfilling this task. Instead, their history is one of bloodshed and conquest, wealth and power, dark secrets and conspiracies. Today, the story of the Knights Templar is intimately linked with the story of the Holy Grail. But what exactly is this ancient artifact, and how has it been used to manipulate history for the last one thousand years?
This book, based on the notes of the recently deceased historian, Dr. Emile Fouchet, attempts to unlock the secrets of the Knights Templar. It begins with an examination of their historical origins, their growth in the early middle-ages, and their supposed destruction under the charges of heresy. From there, it uses the clues left by the Templars themselves to reconstruct their secret journeys as they moved the Holy Grail from Europe to the New World and back. It also charts the secret, three-way war that is still being fought between the Templars, the Freemasons, and the Catholic Church. Finally, the book reveals the greatest of all Templar conspiracies, the attempt to found a new world order under the auspices of the European Union.

-Publisher's description

186663.name: The Wars of Atlantis
186663.description:
On the very edge of recorded history, the fabled island of Atlantis formed the centre of a vast and powerful empire. From there, the divinely-descended lords of the western ocean made war on the rest of the world, until a brave resistance drove them back, and the gods punished them for their hubris. In that last cataclysmic struggle between gods and mortals, the whole island continent sank beneath the sea.

For the first time, this book reconstructs the fact and fiction of that lost age of gods and heroes, including the political organization of the Atlantean Empire, the equipment and tactics of the armies of Atlantis and their enemies, and the stories of the great wars themselves, from the early struggles between Atlantean colonies and the Amazons of North Africa to the final and catastrophic counter-invasion of Atlantis by the peoples of Europe and Asia.

-Publisher's description

186664.name: Outremer
186664.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dream of what could have been. Outremer is an alt-historical game, set in a world where the crusader states have lasted into the 16th century. This game can be played with or without magic as desired. If you want magic, there are nine Paths of Power, flying carpets, Djinn, Kabbalah, Sufi mystics, Half-angels, and the power of the archangels. Along with 3 major religions with various sects, political games, espionage, and war, it's a terrific setting for gaming.

The 11 nations of Outremer - Acre, Aleppo, Antioch, Aqaba, Armenia, Ascalon, cyprus, Damascus, Edessa, Homs, jerusalem, Rhodes, and Tripoli - have managed to survive into the mid 16th century by balancing opposition, trade, and banding together when needed. After 500 years, they have evolved a modus vivendi which allows - if not peace, then a tradition of getting along without cutting their own throats.

Creating your Association first allows you to make your characters with already existing ties, resources, and support, and if the players make the Association, it allows the GM to see what you all are interested in.

186665.name: Otto Minuti per un Impero: Tabellone XL

186666.name: Bases Loaded Board Game
186666.description:
(From the back of the box)

Get Ready for 9 Innings of Fun!

In Bases Loaded, each roll of the dice represents an At Bat.

Out-Roll your opponent on offense to hit doubles, triples, and even home runs!

Utilize the strategy cards to steal bases, bunt and more!

With two different ways to play, Bases Loaded is fun for all ages!

Bases Loaded is a simple simulation of baseball. One player is "at-bat" and one player is "in-the-field". The both roll three six-sided dice and the highest roll uses their dice result to determine the outcome. It's a single for the "at-bat" player and an "out" for the "in-the-field" player. There are special results on rolls of doubles (two dice having the same number) and triples (all three dice having the same number) for both players (provided they win the roll off).

The come comes with a LARGE set of cardboard stand-up players that are moved around the bases. However, there is no "outfield" players.

In the "advanced" rules, both players are given a set of "one-use" cards which can also affect play. For the "at-bat" player these are: Stolen base x2, Balk x1, Sacrifice x3, Hit by pitch x2, Walk x4, Bunt x2, Double x3, Triple x1 and Home run x2.

For the "in-the-field" player these are: Ground out x4, Pick off x3, Fielder's choice x4, Double play x4, Triple play x1 and Bring it back x2.

That's pretty much it. Other than choosing when to use which card there are not many decisions to make and no way to influence the dice rolled, so that parts primarily luck.

A simple family game with nice components.

186667.name: Bunker - The Underground Game
186667.description:
Point & Click your way through puzzles and ridiculous plot twists deep down in a Soviet bunker. Bunker - The Underground Game is probably the most realistic hipster Simulator of 2015.

FEATURING

- Use your wits to solve anything from logical to demented puzzles
- Witness as the mysterious Soviet story line unravels
- Finally experience your darkest desire and be a hipster
- Point and click at stuff and see as the shit gets done
- Summon an intergalactic death hippo from outer space
- Listen to awesome soundtrack... and start a nuclear war
- Discover 33 super secret achievements, if you can...
- Three different endings ;)

Source: The Game Website.

186668.description:
Alternate Art promo card for Marvel Dice Masters: Uncanny X-Men card #49 Professor X: Recruiting Young Mutants.

Obtainable by purchasing the Marvel Dice Masters: The Uncanny X-Men – Collector's Box, or as a prize from attending official WizKids tournaments.
186668.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Uncanny X-Men – Professor X: Recruiting Young Mutants Alternate Art Promo

186669.name: Sock Puppet Charades
186669.description: In this silly twist on Charades, players take turns placing one or two sock puppets on their hands and creatively act out as many of the three items on their card that they can get through before the sand timer runs out. The puppets come with holes on the side and the thumb and pinky are used as arms. The game also comes with small props to help act out the words on the cards. All of the other players try to guess what is being acted out. Both the actor and the correct guesser score points when items are guessed. The player with the most points after the designated number of rounds is the Puppet Master!

186670.name: Mithlund Fantasy Roleplaying (Site)
186670.description:
From the introduction:

Mithlund is available for download from a site that includes various online support pages, including an introduction, several maps, a development diary and message board, and a segment of stories (fiction) set in Mithlund. These various materials are available only via the HTML site and help establish the campaign setting and tone.

186671.name: Mithlund Fantasy 2001 Version
186671.description:
User summary:

The 2001 Version of the core rules updates the alchemy, sorcery, and magic rules. Races have been revised and several Skills have been removed or merged. Additionally, typographical and formatting errors have been eliminated.

Actions are resolved by rolling 1D20 plus modifier against a Difficulty. Higher rolls succeed. Opposed rolls use a mechanism called "matching" where each opponent makes the rolls with the highest result winning. Die rolls of "natural 1" are always considered failure and rolls of "natural 20" are always considered successes.

Character creation uses random rolls to assign values to Primary Attributes; alternately, the values may be allocated from a random pool. Secondary Attributes are then derived. Race is selected and may influence Attributes. Characters have a selected "Affinity" which is (very roughly) analogous to Class but much less restrictive. Characters then select Skills from their Affinity.

186672.name: Mithlund Fantasy 1999 Version
186672.description:
User summary:

Actions are resolved by rolling 1D20 plus modifier against a Difficulty. Higher rolls succeed. Opposed rolls use a mechanism called "matching" where each opponent makes the rolls with the highest result winning. Die rolls of "natural 1" are always considered failure and rolls of "natural 20" are always considered successes.

Character creation uses random rolls to assign values to Primary Attributes; alternately, the values may be allocated from a random pool. Secondary Attributes are then derived. Race is selected and may influence Attributes. Characters have a selected "Affinity" which is (very roughly) analogous to Class but much less restrictive. Characters then select Skills from their Affinity.

186673.name: Rock die Röhre
186673.description:
Drunter, drüber, mittendurch!

Ran an die Rohre - wer ist der schnellste Klempner?

Wer von euch schneidet seinen Mitspielern clever den Weg ab oder blockt gekonnt deren Leitung? Verlegst du am schnellsten deine Pipeline kreuz und quer über dem Spielbrett? Lass es rocken und nimm die Herausforderung an!

Ein Spiel von HCM Kinzel ab 4 Jahren


===========

Underneath, upward, through the middle!

Get to the tubes - who is the fastest plumber?

Which one of you will cleverly cut off your fellow players or skillfully block their way? Will your pipeline be the fastest to crisscross across the board? Rock on and take on the challenge!

A game by HCM Kinzel for 4 years and up.


===========

Each player is given a set of pipes in their colour along a starting pipe coming out of the board. On a turn, the active player rolls the die, which shows the various pipe shapes available, picks up the corresponding piece, and extends his pipeline (or blocks his opponents' if he rolled a dead-end!) Once per game, he may connect his pipeline to the floor to immediately get another turn. The game ends once a player wins by connecting his starting spot to one of the two spots in his colour across the board.

186674.name: Monsters and Mazes
186674.description:
User summary:

Characters have a level assigned, either Beginner, Novice, Expert, or Difficult. These levels are implemented through modifiers to specified tables in the rules. Characters also have a Class and a Race (the normal races plus "Smart Monster"). Characters have two Attributes (Brains and Brawns) and Hit Points. Characters of a magic-using Class may select Spells or Prayers. Characters may then equip, though nearly every item of available equipment deals exclusively with dungeon adventuring or combat. Similarly, almost every Spell and Prayer is focused on dungeon adventuring or combat.

186675.name: Goat Army
186675.description:
Goat War has broken out!
As such, the goats have been prepared and reinforced to carry their army to the victory.

Goat Army is a strategic and cooperative card game where you challenge your friends to a battle with armoured and crazy goats. NSFW deck available!

186676.name: Roll Call
186676.description: Roll Call (Spill and Spell) is an ALL-PLAY letter dice game where you CALL IT AS YOU SEE IT! ROLL out the 22 letters and 7 category dice. Then, CALL out the first words you can make that fit the given category. For every Category you CALL out, you collect that die. Once all category dice are earned, its time to ROLL and CALL again! First player to earn 20 points is the winner!

186677.name: My Love for You Is Way out of Line
rpg: My Love for You Is Way out of Line
186677.description:
User summary:

My Love for You Is Way out of Line is a peculiar fusion of role-playing and board game that plays out in an office building represented by a chessboard. One player is Bob, a clumsy and lovelorn office worker who is attempting to court the other player, Imelda, a competent accountant and power worker. A third player is Gorm, a piece of sea sponge that Bob uses to moisten stamps. A fourth (optional) player is Nancy, a guard dog that always ends the game by killing Bob.

Play involves Imelda randomizing her desires (utilizing "Spark Charts") and Bob moving about the office (chessboard), trying to work up his nerve, and trying to talk to Imelda. After several failed attempts he irritates Nancy who kills him.

186678.name: Barbie: Bring The Bling Game
186678.description:
Barbie: Bring the Bling Game includes 24 glamtastic rings. Take em, Wear em, Swap em. 2 Pinktastic shades included. Pinktastic Shades reveal a secret design that can be seen when sunglasses are on.

The object is to get at least one ring of each of the four Barbie icons to win. To play, put all of the rings face down in the center of the play area. The first player puts the Barbie sunglasses on and spins, following the instructions on the spinner. The sunglasses are only passed to another player when indicated by the spinner. The spinner may indicate passing the sunglasses, taking the sunglasses, drawing a ring or passing a ring. Any time a player thinks she has one ring of each of the Barbie icons she can say Bling. The other players take turns looking at the rings with the sunglasses on to see if she is right. If she is correct, she wins. If she is not, she puts one ring back in the middle and play continues.

186679.name: The NC Combat System
rpg: The NC Role-playing and Combat System
186679.description:
User summary:

The NC Combat System is intended to be a modular replacement for the combat system utilized in the standard Advanced Dungeons & Dragons rules. The system is completely different and novel. Characters have additional Attributes to support the system, including Offense Ability, Defense Ability, Armor Value, and Damage Reduction.

Hit Points are not much improved by Class and Level, but represent size and toughness. They also are "scaled up" so that a human character will have around 60 (average) to 100 (robust) hit points. Weapons cause ten times the damage as previously (e.g., a longsword does 10-80 points of damage). Rest and recovery are much, much slower than previously. Combat supports critical hits and saving rolls. The amount of time in a combat round is adjusted and various actions are specified in terms of segments.

Generally speaking, the combat in The NC Combat System is more complex than that in the AD&D system but also is much more consistent in approach. The intent of the system was to simplify operation, shorten play time, and present a more "realistic" combat action.

186680.name: The NC Character System
rpg: The NC Role-playing and Combat System
186680.description:
From the introduction:

NC is a role-playing system which is designed as a collection of different "chunks". Some of the chunks are constructed in such a way that they can be used with standard fantasy role-playing systems. For example, the NC Combat System is one of these.

This particular chunk defines the statistics of a role-playing character, and how to generate that character: the NC Character System. Using the NC Character System will improve the quality of play, particularly with the NC skill system. However, using the character system also requires that you use the combat System and the skill System.

The NC Character System provides a nice compromise between systems which represent the character as a tiny list of attributes which are far too vague to actually mean anything, and those systems which require that the player spend hours generating minutely detailed lists of numbers.

An NC character has 6 major character attributes. These attributes are generated from 12 minor attributes. He also has 5 combat attributes, which are described in The NC Combat System. The process for determining the combat attributes is different for characters generated using the Character System.

186681.name: The NC Skill System
rpg: The NC Role-playing and Combat System
186681.description:
From the introduction:

Skills are one of the most critical aspects of any role-playing system. More than almost any other aspect of a character, they shape the actions the character takes. The "standard" role-playing system has a rigid, limited system for acquiring skills. The total selection of acquirable skills is very limited. Further, there are strict limits on the acquirable skills, dependent on the class of the character.

The NC skill system allows characters to develop skills in a variety of areas; far more skills than a character from the "standard" system can acquire: anything from Weaponless Combat to Cook. At the same time, the skills are linked in such a way that the set of skills a character knows will usually be related to each other, or fall into a few basic groups. You can be a jack-of-all-trades, but will indeed be a master of none.

By spending experience, a character can either gain new skills or improve existing ones. Some new skills will require an initial "entry" roll to determine whether the character is able to gain the skill. The chance of success will depend on some attribute of the character.

Most skills will require practice in the skill to improve, and certain skills will require that particular actions be performed for advancement to be possible.

Skills may be improved faster by finding a mentor proficient in the skill, who can instruct the character. This applies only up to a certain level of ability.

The system is designed so that the referee can design new skills, and easily plug them into the existing framework.

186682.name: The NC Skill Catalog
rpg: The NC Role-playing and Combat System
186682.description:
User summary:

The NC Skill Catalog presents hundreds of defined Skills that are usable with The NC Skill System. Skills are grouped into categories, including: Combat, Movement, Woodcraft/Tracking, Dungeoneering, Social, Academic, Vehicles, Medical, and Artistic. Skills have a base requirement, a possible prerequisite, a possible modifier, use notes, and descriptions.

186683.name: Neon Twilight
186683.description:
User summary:

Neon Twilight pairs a rules-light and somewhat standard role-playing game with a rich, textured, and well-developed Cyberpunk setting focused on North America in 2037. Published in 1999, many of the "future events" noted in the game's timeline are remarkable prescient while others are familiar tropes in cyberpunk. The site provides these major HTML sections, each with sub-sections: Main, World, Timeline, Society, Entities, Mutation, Gameplay, Techno, Missions, Fiction, and Misc.

The online product is complete and usable, though the author notes only about half of the completed material is available through the site. Much additional material is freely available from the author upon request.

186684.name: Neo-Troops (3rd Ed.)
186684.description:
User summary:

The third edition of Neo-Troops primarily concerns updates and changes to weaponry. Explosions are handled differently and two-weapon fighting rules have been provided. Methods for switching weapons, dodging, melee attacks, and critical hits have been adjusted. The rules section addressed to Game Masters has been expanded to include numerous explanations, suggestions, and clarifications.

The game still revolves around bio-engineered super-varans (large humanoid reptiles) carrying out missions that invariably involve much combat and killing. Equipment remains significant and important. Types (effectively, classes), attributes, and resolution mechanisms remain the same.

186685.name: Neo-Troops (2nd Ed.)
186685.description:
User summary:

In Neo-Troops, players run characters that are bio-engineered super-varans--large reptilian humanoids. Super-Varans begin life with no feelings, no personality, no memories, and no personal motivations, existing only to complete missions. They belong to a specific Type (similar to class in most systems) that defines not only their abilities but their role in missions. Types include: Standard, Assault, Firepower, and Scout. Some varans (predominantly Standard Type) receive additional enhancements to support mission role.

Varans are defined as much by the extensive high tech equipment they carry as they are by their consciousness. The rules present numerous types of equipment--nearly all weapons, armors, or soldier supports. Drugs are widely used as performance enhancers.

186686.name: Neo-Troops (1st Ed.)
186686.description:
User summary:

The first edition of Neo-Troops is written in Finnish; no English translation was made, though subsequent editions of the game were written in English.

In the game, players run characters that are bio-engineered super-varans. Super-Varans, large humanoid reptiles, begin life with no feelings, no personality, no memories, and no personal motivations, existing only to complete missions. Missions invariably involve extensive combat, much danger, and much killing. Varans are created to fulfill a specific mission role, and that role defines most of their abilities and how they are intended to function on a tactical level.

Varans always are heavily armed and armored, and additionally have extensive equipment support including performance-enhancing drugs and even the occasional cybernetic implant.

186687.name: Neo-Troops Campaigns
186687.description:
User summary:

Neo-Troops is played in a generic science-fiction setting with very little background information. The game assumes that politics, social issues, economic strife, and so forth exist in the milieu but are unimportant to (and unknown by) the varan warriors who exist only to complete missions.

Several campaign support materials are provided on the web site, aside from the rules. These include:


Local Campaign - a summary of missions held over several years (1999-2002), noting mission target, difficulty, date, players, result, and comments. Several missions were played at conventions. Minor aggregate statistics also are presented. English.
Varan Awards - a list of named varans and their Type and player, how many missions they played in, and what Awards they received. Varan awards often are curiously named. English.
Ropecon 2001 - convention notes about two missions. These could easily serve as adventures or templates for GMs. Finnish.


Incidentally, there also is a board-game implementation named Neo-Hunt and a card-game implementation named Neo-Combat.

186688.description:
Summary:

Neo-Hunt 3 is a round-based, multi-phase board/card game for 2-4 players. Each player controls a team of three "varans" (large, humanoid reptiles bio-engineered for combat). Players try to kill as many "troopers" and opponents as possible before one team is eliminated. Opponents include the varans of other players as well as "troopers" (non-player game tokens) who occupy the game board and arrive at the beginning of each turn.

Setup:

Each player selects a color and takes all the pieces for that color. Players sit on corners of the playing surface. The game board randomly is generated by creating a 3x3 grid from the board pieces. Each of the nine sectors of the game board provides various terrain benefits or penalties. During the game a total of fifty "troopers" will deploy into various sectors and players may move their varan units into sectors.

Game Play:

Play proceeds in turns. During turn setup, each player selects and plays four action cards. Then play proceeds in player order, with each player in sequence executing their four played action cards. Action cards are resolved in the order of priority indicated on their face; they may distribute damage tokens. Damaged "troopers" are eliminated and varans with enough accumulated damage tokens also are eliminated. After each player has taken their phase all "troopers" take automatic actions of either shooting at a visible varan or, if no varans are visible to them, by moving to a new sector. At the end of each turn new "troopers" deploy onto the board if any counters remain.

The game continues until end of turn when there are no more trooper counters on the board or one varan team has all its members killed. When game ends, the player with most points wins. If tied, the one with most surviving varans, and if still tied, tied victory.

User Comments:

The game is print-and-play and published for free access via HTML. Components and rules are downloadable in PDF format. Color printing is recommended.
186688.name: Neo-Hunt 3

186689.name: Neo-Combat
186689.description:
User summary:

Neo-Combat is a card game using print-and-play materials. Players hold "Varan" cards, which represent a combatant reptilian humanoid controlled by the player. Players also draw, hold, and play "Action" cards that drive the game. Varan cards are always played on the table but begin play in the "Cloaked" (face down) position. Varans remain "Cloaked" until play dictates otherwise, when they are turned face up and thus become much more vulnerable.

The playing surface is divided into Sectors which join in a central "Battlefield" Sector. Play involves moving Varan cards between Sectors and playing Action cards to evolve maneuvers. The goal of the game is to eliminate all of the other players' Varan cards. Played Action cards and defeated Varan cards go into Discard.

186690.name: Wordwright
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 091 - Mistfall
186690.description: A card game platform using word parts (roots, prefixes and suffixes) to find, build and reform words across several games of varying length and complexity.

186691.name: Human Resource Machine
186691.description:
Human Resource Machine is a puzzle game. In each level, your boss gives you a job. Automate it by programming your little office worker! If you succeed, you'll be promoted up to the next level for another year of work in the vast office building. Congratulations!

Don't worry if you've never programmed before - programming is just puzzle solving. If you strip away all the 1's and 0's and scary squiggly brackets, programming is actually simple, logical, beautiful, and something that anyone can understand and have fun with!

Source: The Developer Website.

186692.name: Coloma
186692.description:
Pan for gold in this unique worker placement game!
