Welcome to the town of Coloma! Players play the role of gold miners that have arrived in Coloma, Montana in 1848 upon hearing of the chance discovery of gold in the surrounding area. As one of the first prospectors to arrive you have a head start on the swarm of fortune seekers heading west and a great opportunity to become some of the biggest Gold Mining Tycoons in America!

During the early stages of the game the players have no workers and must Placer Mine the rivers by themselves, panning for small deposits of gold. By the end of the game the players may have built a street of buildings in the town of Coloma funded by a successful gold mining operation in the mountains, employing a team of hopeful workers to produce dozens of gold bars and amassing a fortune!

What makes the game unique is the mechanic that allows players to simulate gold panning using the game box and the double sided 'Alluvium' chits.

186693.name: Lalaloopsy: Find 'N Seek – Memory Match Spinning Game
186693.description:
A neat game is the Lalaloopsy Find N’ Seek – Memory Match Spinning Game. As the name suggests, this game is played to enhance the memory of the child by making him/her remember the images on the play card and then matching the image with those of the other cards. The game consists of 1 console, 8 chunky play cards, 1 mix up card, and 1 free spin card. The game also improves hand eye coordination since the children need to pick up the cards to see the images.

A fun interactive memory game for kids!

Pull the handle to make their matches! Your children will improve their memory skills and hand eye coordination with Lalaloopsy Find ‘n Seek!

186694.name: Zombology
186694.description:
Zombitis is sweeping the globe: it’s killed millions and billions more are at risk. There’s no government stockpiled vaccines and pharmaceutical companies have nothing. You and your peers are mankind’s only hope. Just a couple of months ago they were ridiculing your ‘Advanced Projects Agency’ for its crackpot ideas, now they are praying that those very ideas might just save humanity.

You’ve got eight weeks to try to cure the zombie plague - will you be heralded as one of the saviours of mankind or will you back the wrong therapy and remain a crackpot till the end of your days? Work together to achieve a cure or trip up therapies that you don’t support. Time’s running out...

Zombology is played over eight rounds, each round players choose a card from their hand to either contribute to the eradiction of the disease by performing research in one of six therapies or to play an event either boosting one of the therapies or overrunning an opponent's lab with zombies. The remaining cards in their hand are then drafted to the next player, so players build up a picture of which therapies might offer a cure as the game goes on. Therapy cards range in value from 1 to 6 and can only be played if any player has played the card below it (i.e. playing a four requires a 3 in that therapy in play) and then game ends when one or more 6s are played in a round. Players work together, trying to co-operatively generate enough evidence for a cure, but not everyone will win - only those who have backed the right cure will be lauded, or everyone might die!

186695.description:
The Terrifying Girl Disorder is a quirky and brain-burning set-collecting card game. The deck consists of seven different types of cards, with each type represented by a girl with numbers 1–7 and a special power. Players start with a hand of cards, and each round play any number of identical cards from hand, activate that girl's special power, then collect new cards, using a weird drafting mechanism.

Each player can play a certain numbered set only once per game. When the game ends, the player who has played the most cards of a certain girl "becomes" that girl. Each different girl has a completely different way of scoring, so you need to adapt to the other player's play rapidly.

(The title is an allusion to a novel set in a distant future in which girls around the world start manifesting supernatural powers, and they are more or less treated as threats to humanity.)
186695.name: The Terrifying Girl Disorder

186696.name: It's A Chicken
186696.description: A fun and exciting drawing game for kids! It's a chicken will provide hours of hilarious fun for kids of all ages and also encourages them to interact and to use their imaginations. Can the other players guess what you are drawing? In this 'easy to play' game the sheets are pre-printed with circles to make starting the picture even easier! Each word card contains four options to draw, one with a picture to copy to help younger children play. The 'chicken' timer 'clucks' to let the drawer know they are running out of time and if the word is guessed within the time limit the timer announces the number of points won for both the drawer and the person who guessed correctly. The player with the most points when each player has draw 5 cards wins! This game provides a sheet of printed circle layouts, which can be photocopied to give you more sheets and a lot more hours of fun. This educational game will help children express themselves through a variety of different drawing skills and at the same time the electronic timer adds to the tension and the fun! Whatever age you are, this game is great fun for the whole family. This game is for 3 or more players and suitable for ages 5 years and up.

186697.name: Sorcerers & Sellswords
186697.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a company of adventurers in a land of weird fantasy.

S&S was written as a hack of John Harper's Lasers & Feelings. It is perfect for one-shot games or short campaigns in worlds inspired by Fafhrd & the Gray Mouser, Ray Harryhausen's Sinbad movies, Conan, Thundarr the Barbarian, etc.

186698.name: Zoolu Card Game
186698.description:
Zoolu is a fun family card game. The aim of the game is to collect a full set of cartoon animal cards, called Wild! Cards. Wild! Cards come in five Colours (blue, green, pink, white, orange) and five Types (cheeky, cruisy, freaky, cutesy, zany).
Target Cards tell each player the Colour or Type they must collect, and the first player to collect their full set of cards 'goes wild!' and wins the game.

Kaos! Cards add strategy and see players swapping, swiping, stockpiling and surrendering cards in their bid to 'go wild!' first.

186699.name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Side Stories
boardgamefamily: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles
186699.description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering 3rd and 4th battle of Tiamat Star zone.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.

186701.description:
Burger Up is a card matching puzzle game about the art of burger making. Fill orders, earn prestige and be the best burger chef around!

Players strive to become the most prestigious restaurant by building the biggest Burgers and by using the best ingredients.

Players take turns, which consist of four phases: the Market phase where players may purchase ingredients from the market, the Building phase where players place up to 3 ingredients on their burgers, the Burger Up! phase where players may score their burgers if they satisfy an order and the clean-up phase where players draw back up to 4 cards.

The game ends when no more Order cards can be revealed. A bonus is awarded to the Chef who built the most burgers and then the winner is determined, based on who has earned the most coins.

Contents:

21× Top Bun Cards
4× Player Aid Cards
72× Ingredient Cards
8× Bottom Bun Cards
4× Spatula Cards
32× $1 Coins
20× $5 Coins
8× $10 Coins
Rulebook
Plastic Tray Insert suitable for sleeved cards
186701.name: Burger Up
boardgameexpansion: Burger Up: Burgers of the World
boardgamepodcastepisode: #40: A Feast for Odin six-pack; Burger Up on tap; New York Slice & More
Ep 45 Down Under With Rule & Make
Episode 90- The Oracle of Delphi and Wisdom Check 4 (with Stephen Buonocore, plus CONTEST)
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 122

186702.name: Soccer Shootout
186702.description:
Do you have nerves of steel and steady mind? Try your skills in this soccer duel.

In Soccer Shooout two players take roles of soccer teams and play this final stage of match where each tries to score more goals in 5 shots than his opponent.
Each shot is asymetrical as goalkeeper and attacker has different sets of cards, but entire game is symetrical cause both players takes each role as often.

Pdf's for pnp are in the "Files" section.

186703.name: Masks of Lankhmar
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
186703.description:
From publisher blurb:

Authorized by the estate of Fritz Leiber!

A level 1 adventure for DCC RPG

A heist gone wrong brings an unlikely group of thieves together and sets off a search for forgotten treasures hidden in the City of the Black Toga! Can our heroes of questionable moral character survive the twisting chase that leads through the Plaza of Dark Delights, crosses paths with Sheelba of the Eyeless Face, and delves into one of the oddest tenements in Lankhmar? Not if the Thieves’ Guild has their way!

Masks of Lankhmar is the inaugural adventure written for Goodman Games’ new DCC Lankhmar line of supplements produced with the approval of the Estate of Fritz Leiber. This 1st level adventure is specially designed to start a DCC Lankhmar game set in the City of Sevenscore Thousand Smokes and provides the judge with the perfect means to assemble the players and kick of the campaign. That is, assuming they survive, of course!

186704.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module BH1: The Blood Howlers of Black Willow Gorge
186704.description:
From publisher blurb:

The trail was not hard to follow, even in the dark. The creatures moved quickly and with no fear of being followed. And when there was doubt, there was always the river that flowed from the west, from the depths of Black Willow Gorge. Somewhere in the dark depths of that gorge is the horn that sounded in the night, the young girl from the settler’s wagon and the creatures that carried her there.

Face the horrors of Black Willow Gorge!

Universal Adventures The Blood Howlers of Black Willow Gorge is the first part in a new two-part Adventure Module set north of the town of Ravenor along the eastern edge of Greyshroud Ridge. You can combine the adventure with Expedition to Erathor and the expansion pack, Greyshroud Ridge, or play the adventure independently. The Adventure Module includes a new Adventure Record, 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards and 18 Treasure cards.

The Blood Howlers of Black Willow Gorge takes the characters into a deadly new environment, full of dangerous new foes, fabulous treasure and wonders to behold. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, The Blood Howlers of Black Willow Gorge can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and compatible with other Universal Adventures cards. In addition, you can combine the cards with other cards from the series, or cards from other Universal Adventures products, to create your own adventures.

186705.name: Mastermind
186705.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Argo Galaxy is growing – not physically but figuratively. After years of study, the House of the Alliance has finally decided to open the Hastilion Expanse for full settlement and corporate utilization. Researchers identified numerous planets and moons as optimal for civilization and corporations from around the known galaxy, including Drake Mining and Manufacturing, are making plans to acquire land.

Since its inception, Drake Mining and Manufacturing has prided itself on mining resources and creating high-quality products from those resources to support the entire galaxy. Moving into the Hastilion Expanse provides them with a wealth of opportunities to expand their operations and grow their business. That is, of course, if their new facilities can survive.

New planets are always fraught with hidden dangers from native flora and fauna, pirates, rival corporations, and rebellious populations. Only the strength of Drake’s mercenary force will help them overcome any roadblocks and become successful. As long as they don’t get killed in the process.

Mastermind presents the Seasoned portion of the Hastilion Expanse campaign for Mercenary Breed Savage Worlds or it can be used as a collection of adventures for any sci-fi setting. Originally published in Savage Insider Premium and the Hastilion Expanse Compendiums, this new campaign book updates the content to Mercenary Breed 2.0 and expands on the original content.

Mastermind includes:

Seasoned-rank campaign missions.
A collection of additional Seasoned-rank adventures based within the Drake Mining and Manufacturing setting.
New Xenopedia entries.

186706.name: Shadow World Module (RMC)
186706.description:
From publisher blurb:

ERA (Electronic Roleplaying Assistant) is the ultimate companion for Rolemaster campaigns. Using ERA players can create their characters using a step by step wizard, then level them up and configure all details in stats, skills and special abilities, even overriding the automatic calculations. Afterwards, they can be added to a running campaign in the adventuring module. From there, the game master can control all aspects of the game: resolve maneuvers, resistances, resting, and of course, spell casting and combat.

With ERA, you can create Rolemaster characters and then manage their adventures. Players can also monitor their characters from their mobile devices as the action progresses. To create an interesting character, a good selection of race and profession is paramount. Rolemaster also provides background options to add more variety between characters. In the free base ERA product you will find 2 sample races, 2 professions and 3 background options.

This feature package is the ultimate Shadow World addition for ERA RMC.

It provides 68 RMC races, as presented in Shadow World Master Atlas. Each race impacts stat and resistance bonus, initial languages, number of background options available, and includes the complete detail of description and special characteristics.

Pick from any of 68 races (yes, sixty eight!). Fair skinned Linaeri elves, or sinister Dyari, stout Umli, the winged Hírazi and the reclusive Dúranaki. Are you aiming for a character in a high-powered campaign, or a detailed NPC? Why not create a Storm Giant? Of course, you can always choose to create a K’ta’viiri, just ask your GM very nicely for permission.

Also, any future Shadow World content developed for ERA RMC will be included in this same package.

186707.name: Shadow World Module (RMSS/RMFRP)
186707.description:
From publisher blurb:

ERA (Electronic Roleplaying Assistant) is the ultimate companion for Rolemaster campaigns. Using ERA players can create their characters using a step by step wizard, then level them up and configure all details in stats, skills and special abilities, even overriding the automatic calculations. Afterwards, they can be added to a running campaign in the adventuring module. From there, the game master can control all aspects of the game: resolve maneuvers, resistances, resting, and of course, spell casting and combat.

With ERA, you can create Rolemaster characters and then manage their adventures. Players can also monitor their characters from their mobile devices as the action progresses. To create an interesting character, a good selection of race and profession is paramount. Rolemaster also provides background options to add more variety between characters. In the free base ERA product you will find 2 sample races, 2 professions and 3 background options.

This feature package is the ultimate Shadow World addition for ERA RMFRP.

It provides 68 RMFRP races, as presented in Shadow World Master Atlas 4th Edition. Each race impacts stat and resistance bonus, body and power point progression, initial languages, number of talent points, everyman and restricted skills, and includes the complete detail of description and special characteristics.

Pick from any of 68 races (yes, sixty eight!). Fair skinned Linaeri elves, or sinister Dyari, stout Umli, the winged Hírazi and the reclusive Dúranaki are all available. Are you aiming for a character in a high-powered campaign, or a detailed NPC? Why not create a Storm Giant? Of course, you can always choose to create a K’ta’viiri, just ask your GM very nicely for permission.

It also provides 14 RMFRP cultures, to match with the races as suggested in the Shadow World Master Atlas 4th Edition. For human cultures with choice, the 6 available options are presented. For campaigns which require it, any combination can be picked. So why not try creating a Kuluku raised in the underground, or even in the city!

186708.name: The Books Of The Undead, Volume 1: Skeletons
186708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Skeletons, the first in the Books of the Undead series, provides character sheets for 21 types of skeletons for players and GMs. They range from humanoid skeletons with various abilities and powers that make them tough foes for the PCs, to skeletons of monsters and animals -- including the fearsome Skelesaurus!

186709.name: The Books Of The Undead, Volume 3: Ghosts
186709.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghosts, the third volume in the Books of the Undead series, presents character sheets for 14 different types of ghosts, including the Apparition, Haunt, Phantom, Poltergeist, and Ghost Wolf!

186710.name: The Expanded Grimoire: Desert Magic
186710.description:
From publisher blurb:

Desert Magic contains twelve new spells for the HERO System that are learned and used by people who inhabit deserts, or who frequently travel through them.

186711.description:
Manhattan TraffIQ - 5th Avenue expansion

Description:
Another player joins into the game. Also, nine new city tiles are available.
186711.name: Manhattan TraffIQ: 5th Avenue

186712.name: The Expanded Grimoire: Expanded Warrior-Magery
186712.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expanded Warrior-Magery contains ten new spells for the HERO System for characters who want to combine spellcasting with swordplay, or who’d like to enhance their melee combat skills with the power of magic.

186713.name: Acquitaine: The Realm of the Summer King
186713.description:
From publisher blurb:

Acquitaine describes the kingdom of the same name. It’s part of the Tuala Morn setting (which is described in the book of the same name from Hero Games), but can be used by itself or as part of another world. It covers the history, society, lands, and nobles of the “Summer Kingdom.” It also includes a magic system (with several new spells) and six new monsters.

186714.description:
Manhattan TraffIQ: Broadway expansion

With 9 new tiles featuring the diagonal running Broadway, the game gets much more strategic.

The chessboard pattern of the Manhattan city map is intersected by one of the most famous streets in the world: The Broadway runs diagonally to the otherwise right-angled street network. The new roads allow the taxis and trucks to carry out refined maneuvers in order to keep the competitors' vehicles out of circulation.

The "taxi ride" and "truck delivery" actions can now also be done over existing diagonal roads. A truck's journey across a diagonal road leads only from one intersection / road corner to the diagonally opposite corner of the same city tile. While "competing", diagonal roads count as a separate road, but only to the intersection / corner, where the diagonal road is not continued in the same direction.
186714.name: Manhattan TraffIQ: Broadway

186715.description:
With 9 new tiles featuring the diagonal the ferry lines around Manhattan, the game gets even more strategic.

The East River borders Manhattan to the southeast. Famous bridges, including the Brooklyn Bridge, cross the East River. But also the ferry lines across the river are now to be considered.

In addition to red, beige, green and blue, there is now a fifth kind of tile edge: a dashed white line on blue (water) surfaces stands for a (passenger) ferry connection. In addition, a fifth symbol makes it clear that this tile side can only be attached to the same tile sides (with a ferry connection). Because of their small number, this is rarely possible and is therefore rewarded with a "free" draw of city tiles.
186715.name: Manhattan TraffIQ: East River

186716.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 77 - Oct 2015)
rpgissuearticle: House of the Yellow Sign & Surroundings
House of the Yellow Sign & Surroundings
186716.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people of that area. Full color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided on the hex itself, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up of the hex, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House of the Healing Sun
School of Sorcery
School of Spirit Mastery
School of Summoning

186718.name: Secret Santa: Krampus
186718.description: Krampus is a free promotional card that expands the game Secret Santa. Its power in the game is reversing the playing order.

186719.name: Secret Santa: Mrs Claus
186719.description: This is a free promotional card that expands the game Secret Santa. Its power is the game is either the same as that of an elf, or to trump Santa Claus.

186720.name: New Realms Lite
186720.description:
User summary:

Characters in the system begin with a character concept, background, and description. Characters have four Attributes: Body, Quickness, Mental, and Virtue, with a Rating of 1-20 with 4 being an average human and 10 being a human maximum. Characters also have a variety of derived scores, most involving combat performance. Skills are purchased from a point pool derived from Attributes. Each Skill has a Level running from 1-10; the system enumerates sixteen skills.

All actions are resolved by the GM setting a Difficulty Score. Any Attribute or Skill bonuses, or situational bonuses are penalties, are added/subtracted from the Difficult Score--the die roll never is modified. The character then rolls 1d20 and attempts to "roll under" the Difficulty Score. A roll of 1 always means success; 20 always means failure.

186721.description:
Welcome to Anytown, U.S.A. where people grumble about the quality of their health care but still show up at Healthy Heart Hospital hoping they made a smart decision. Much has been said (and even more has been written) about the previous administration’s haphazard management of Healthy Heart. In an effort to save the Hospital, you and your allies among its leading Physicians have staged a recent “Clinical Coup” and taken over the Hospital to restore its prestige. However, actually managing things from the inside is never as easy as it appears from the outside, and juggling the responsibilities at Healthy Heart Hospital can quickly turn even the noblest healer into a money-grubbing pragmatist cynically looking for a place to hide the victims of your “care.”
Does your team have what it takes to bring Healthy Heart Hospital back to its former glory without becoming Hard Hearted in the process?
Healthy Heart Hospital is a cooperative game for 1 to 5 players, played in rounds, with each player spending actions to treat and (hopefully) cure the various patients that come pouring into the hospital each round. Patients are represented by a number of cubes of various colors. Color represents the type of illness, while the number of cubes represents the severity of the illness.
186721.name: Healthy Heart Hospital
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 25: Shiny!
Episode 29 - GenCon 2016 Two-Player Preview
Episode 42 :: Board Game of the Year 2016 - Brawling Brothers Awards
GrogCast Season 3, Episode Cinco!
Hearty Health Hospital
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 72!!

186722.description:
"It is the near future; Earth. Years ago, scientists successfully constructed the Belief Engine, a machine that warps reality based on peoples’ strongly held beliefs. The machine was turned on for testing, but it proved too sensitive: widespread belief in the depravity of man and fears of social collapse suddenly took on the full force of objective fact, and science skepticism rendered the Engine’s creators helpless to intervene. Without resort to a shared external reality, civilization crumbled like a sand castle in the tide.

"From the ruins have now arisen cults led by charismatic, messianic figures possessed of seemingly divine powers derived from the still-functioning Engine. You are one such a figure—the true one, the Messiah. It is God’s will that you build temples and marshal followers, then mold their beliefs to perform miracles and destroy your rivals. They’ll be doing the same, but don’t worry–God is on your side…"

Rounds go player by player, with each individual player turn broken up into phases:

1) Beginning (reset any praying followers to active status; recruit followers and build temples; draw back up to 6 cards);
2) Action (move units, have followers on temples pray to produce belief, use belief to perform miracles);
3) Combat (adjacent enemy units attack one another according to deterministic rules);
4) End (discard down to 3 cards, loot any empty enemy temple you have units left adjacent to, make sure you have enough units left to support the continued functioning of your own temples).

Each round ends with the Market, in which players make secret bids on an assortment of 5-7 miracle cards. Bidders get to spend their bid on up to 2 cards, with high bidders buying first. Purchased cards are placed into each player's discard pile, eventually to be cycled back into their decks Dominion-style.

A player wins by slaying an enemy messiah, by reducing an enemy to less than 4 followers, by capturing an enemy's holy city, or by reducing an enemy to less than 8 miracle cards.
186722.name: True Messiah
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 70: Thursday, September 29th

boardgameintegration: Cave Evil
Cave Evil
186723.description:
Stand-Alone game, integrates with Cave Evil.

"It knows no light, this Cave,

"Endless tunnels, endless battle, endless death...

I awoke among my species, mine folk. I have risen, understood, grasped and taken my power, those below my slaves! I shall raise great armies to massacre any enemy! These territories are mine, only the weak to destroy! Shadow deities pretend to stand above me, but I shalt not kneel. I shall sit on any throne!

Tonight I am Warlord, an oath declared! The weak and shoddy I shall craft into powerful warriors, warriors into command, command into my Lord of all Battles! Together we conquer! Our species will rule the caverns of black! Into the Warrior Path!"

Cave Evil: Warcults is a stand alone game. Players who own Cave Evil can expand their game with Warcults. It can be played either as an individual game or as an expansion.

Players who own Cave Evil have the liberty to play as only a Warlord, only a Necromancer or both.
Players who own Warcults will begin as a Warlord, but they will be able to connect each future Corroded Corridor to this issue.

GAMEPLAY
As we learned in CAVE EVIL, a Necromancer can weave a web of control over 6 Squads, but their power does not end there. While they may dominate 6 squads, others may swear their allegiance to the infernal magi. The cave is endless. Battles for territory will forever ensue. The forbidden wizards must raise troops from their species, create Warriors from the weak and shoddy, inspire Command and demand the allegiance of their greatest Warlord. The warrior path begins!

Warcults is an introduction to a Warrior Path - the first expansion for CAVE EVIL.

A Warrior path is a way to play Cave Evil. It is a modified Sequence of Play to accommodate players that prefer to play with just a Warlord Character or with both a Warlord and a Necromancer.

The Warlord is a branch of Necro command and is under the allegiance of a Necromancer. The Necromancer is NOT needed to play!

A Warlord commands an army and the divisions of command below them.
Apart from WARCULTS features, the game introduces new actions and adjustments to the overall Sequence of Play.

Victory is dependent on each scenario.
186723.name: Cave Evil: Warcults
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 7 - Ding & Dent's Holiday Gift Guide!
Episode 8 - Nate Hayden Interview

186724.name: Nutcracker Prince
186724.description:
User summary:

Nutcracker Prince uses a fusion of D20 OGL mechanics, Advanced Dungeons & Dragons 2nd Edition proficiency data and magic items, and novel rules. The game is set in a realm with three distinct locations and characters can travel between them. Each realm is distinctive and has some of its own rules. The setting has a medieval feel but also incorporates Renaissance elements, much fairy tale mythology, and black-powder firearms.

A two-page character sheet is available as a separate PDF download.

186725.name: Nutcracker Adventures
186725.description:
User summary:

The document presents two outline adventures for Nutcracker Prince:


The Falling Star Adventure (four "Acts") - the characters are passengers on a ship that is ambushed
Elemental Sand (four "Acts") - the characters are hired as guards by a mining company


A final page lists dozens of NPC names suitable for use in the game.

186726.name: Heisei Hyakunin Issyu
186726.description:
This is educational memory game.
a kind of Ogura Hyakunin Issyu:Japanese ancient card game

There are 100 pair pictures in the game.
Player can play "Old Maid","Concentration" using the cards.
there are hints printed on the cards.
if you know 100 famous ancient Japanese poems , you can win easily.

and you can play traditional Ogura Hyakunin Issyu too.

Heisei Hyakuninn Issyu is compatible.

Ogura is a Japanese place, and Hyakunin mean 100 people. Issyu: one poem. So, the tile means 100 poets who are picked by famous poet Sadaie(Teika) FUJIWARA at Ogura.

The poem is written in ancient Japanese language. Many Japanese students have to memorise 100 poems even if the poem sounds like Greek.

186727.name: Covert Ops GM's Screen
186727.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hide mission-critical intel from operatives!

This is a game master's screen for the Covert Ops role-playing game (see Core Product). It is presented in a 6-page layout to be printed landscape and inserted into sleeve-based universal GM screen systems such as those sold elsewhere. Alternatively, you can print on project paper (the printable self-adhesive paper available at most office supply stores) and adhered to project foamboard, cut and scored to bend properly.

This product came out of a discussion on the DwDStudios forums. DwD Studios is offering this to you in a pay-what-you-want release model. If you lack the funds, download it for free and enjoy! If you have the funds to continue supporting our efforts to provide quality products at realistic prices, pay whatever you'd like and we thank you in advance for your patronage!

This screen has everything one needs to run a Covert Ops game.

The side facing the players has an image of the front cover, along with all outfitting tables the players need to outfit their operatives for an important mission. Unlike the outfitting reference sheets presented in the core rulebook, these tables have complete summaries of how weapons and explosives operate - no more flipping to pages in the core rulebook to arbitrate how that fragmentation grenade works.

The side facing the GM has every necessary table presented from the core rulebook. It includes guidelines for awarding and spending DP, calculating Rank, summaries of the effects from the Getting Hurt section (quick - what's the rule for damage exposure to moderate radiation levels?), Getting Healed, rules summaries for each of the Conditions, ranges, automatic weapons, vehicle chases and combats, taking cover, rules for being at a "disadvantage" (which some of us forget to apply sometimes), the simple success modifier table, the table for breaking things, complete summaries of the rules for all martial maneuvers, and even the tables for dealing with animals for when the operatives find themselves in trouble outside the scope of cities and civilization. This thing is packed.

Finally, a single bonus sheet is provided summarizing all the rules of the Security Systems & Traps section of the core rulebook. Although normally only used during preparation for a mission, it's a great sheet to have handy and pull out when players take their operatives off the mission's prepared path and you have to wing it!

186728.name: A Measure of Faith
186728.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for expert characters

The crusader citadel of Martyr’s Point stands upon profane ground—a fathomless subterranean abyss with the godlike power to warp reality to the shape of what people believe and fear. Ordinarily dormant, it awakens when a dark collective belief empowers it, and sustains it with terror and bloodshed.

A Measure of Faith is about the dangers of belief. It is the story of a lie that becomes powerful because people believe it; an irrational belief that creates enough hysteria to spark a holy war and takes the physical shape of the fictitious boogeyman, Okka the Eater. In the end, the players must choose between feeding the people comfortable lies to keep them ignorant of dark truths they can’t handle, or revealing the grim facts in hopes that the people will use their knowledge responsibly. The test is a measure of faith.

A Measure of Faith is an adventure for expert characters. The group completes this adventure by defeating the manifestation of the abyss and confronting the beliefs that empower it.

186729.name: Olendiak
186729.description:
User summary:

Olendiak is a campaign setting designed for Olendiak Fantasy, though it easily could be adapted to most fantasy systems (and has been partially adapted to GURPS). The setting is minimal and consists essentially of a map, a concise summary, comments on about two-dozen significant places, comments on religions, and a timeline. The information is spread across multiple HTML pages.

The setting has partially been adapted to GURPS and presents a Bestiary, several character Races, and notes on house rules for use with GURPS.

186730.name: Ripper
186730.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born of Death

Ripper (PL 9), as she's known the underworld, hunts monsters. Why? Because she is a monster too, and knows what they're capable of.

An ally to the occult investigator group, the Night Watch, Ripper travels where she is needed, to hunt supernatural beings who make humans either food, or sport.

186731.name: Black Terror vs. Puzzzler
186731.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the fifth issue of Golden Age Thrilling Action!

Written by Superhero RPG superstar John Polojac and ICONS module author Dan Houser and edited by Line Artist for ICONS Dan Houser, this is a Golden Age character pack with a pair of characters from the classic public domain pulp comics of the 40s, and a sample battleground.

This supplement is to be used to either run a quick battle scene for one on one play, or to have a few more characters for your own personal ICONS universe!

And for only a buck!

This issue:

Black Terror -- Super powered pharmacist and crime buster, one of the iconic 40s heroes of the Golden Age of comics!

Vs.

The Puzzzler -- A single encounter wasn't enough! The evil mindbending malcontent is BACK for revenge, taking Tim - Black Terror's sidekick - hostage!

They battle one another within the Puzzler's trap-filled mansion, where Tim is being held hostage! Can the Black Terror reach him in time?

186732.name: Olendiak Fantasy
186732.description:
User summary:

Characters in Olendiak Fantasy have nine Attributes (Agility, Charisma, Endurance, Health, Intelligence, Mana, Perception, Power, and Strength) that are randomly generated from 2d6+3. Skills are then purchased from a point pool (they have unequal costs). The Skill resolution mechanic assigned a numeric penalty to Skill attempts based on the GM-assigned Difficulty of the Skill attempt. Very easy tasks have no penalty, through Heroic tasks that have a -15 penalty. When characters make opposed rolls they both make a Skill check. If both fail, then both fail; if one succeeds, that person succeeds; if both succeed then the attempt is deemed a draw. Skills can be improved through experience or by training.

Combat is handled through a modification of the Skill system. The game requires a Skill allocation for every weapon category. Characters engaged in combat roll 3d10, attempting to "roll under" their Skill score to hit. Weapons do 1d6 + Strength modifier + Weapon damage modifier (which ranges from -1 to 5). Armors reduce damage on every hit (from 1 to 8), so that it is possible to receive a hit that does no damage.

A magic system is presented but is not developed enough to use in a game, without substantive GM input.

boardgameintegration: Naturally Disastrous: Discoverable Items Promo Pack
Naturally Disastrous: Discoverable Items Promo Pack
186733.description:
Naturally Disastrous is a 1-6 player co-operative dice driven game of peril and adventure. Your mission is simple enough. Arrive at your destination, verify the conditions and then set up a long range communication array to deliver your findings back to your superiors. Easy, right? Your visit to Earth is supposed to just be a quick investigation into how the planet is doing.

As you enter the atmosphere massively destructive storms make it hard to navigate. Giant volcanoes, earthquakes, thermal gas explosions and flooding are rampant and tearing the Earth apart and what happens next? You and your crew are shot at by some natives claiming that you are violating their air space. As your ship tears itself apart and plummets to the desert floor you know that your only chance of survival will be to pick up the pieces of your communications array that are now conveniently scattered across the driest most self-destructing climate you have ever seen.

All you have to do is find and set up the four parts of the communications array and signal the mother ship to come heal this planet and get you out of here. You will have to navigate around the perilous hazards, avoid snipers who want you gone, secret agents who are stealing your technology, crazy mad scientists who want to perform experiments on you, and a completely different alien race who may even abduct you. Work together efficiently as a team and you will avoid a Naturally Disastrous fate! If you become mutated, you turn against your former allies.

The game is played on a randomized map, with randomly placed tokens. Each turn, the active player must roll to activate a disaster, and then has 3 actions per turn (move, probe, etc.) Combat is resolved with dice. As each part of the communications array is found, it must be transported to one of the corners of the map.
186733.name: Naturally Disastrous
boardgameexpansion: Naturally Disastrous: Discoverable Items Promo Pack
Naturally Disastrous: Legend of the Shadow Master

186734.name: Hunter
186734.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hunter is a hybrid class that combines a druids power and rangers skills into nature's deadly defender. Often found with an animal companion, the dwell in the forests and jungles, protecting nature from those who would do it harm. Some see it as a religious calling, whilst others become almost animal like in their nature. Whatever their fate is, they are not beings you want to annoy or upset. They will hunt you, track you down, run you ragged, then close in for the kill or take you out from a distance. You may see them, you may not, but there are always there, always watching you.

Featuring
Spell Sacrificing - Give up a ready/prepared spell to power certain feats. The more powerful the spell sacrificed, the greater the bonus

The Feats:

Improved Wild Empath - Wild Empathy Rolls become better.
Master Tracker - Sacrifice a spell to gain a bonus to tracking.
Nature's Defence - Your armor works better when you sacrifice a spell.
Nature's Focus - Your level for abilities gained from animal focus gains a bonus.
Nature's Guidance -Your hits gain accuracy when you sacrifice a spell.
Nature's Protection -Fortitude or Reflex saving throws work better when you sacrifice a spell.
Nature's Teachings- Random, level based effects become more effective, as if you are one level higher.

186735.name: Covenant
186735.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Immortal Mistress of Magick... Covenant!

A Power Level 10 Renegade, Covenant has walked the Earth for generations. She has spent centuries honing both her mystic skills and her anti-mundane prejudices. Covenant is a mystic master in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Covenant is designated "Violet" for her magical origins. She has seen the worst of humanity in her long years on this world, and it has left her with very little respect for those who do not walk the path of magick. She considers "Mundanes" to be both troublesome and of little value. While she rarely sets out to cause trouble for them, she will not hesitate to enter into conflicts with them in defense of mystic beings, even those most mystics might deem overtly dangerous.

186736.name: Core Prestige Classes (Paladin, Ranger, and Rogue)
186736.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prestige classes have taken a back seat to archetypes and hybrid classes of late. Presented are three new prestige classes built upon the core classes they represent. These prestige classes offer an accelerated method of gaining a secondary core class without the need to multi-class for several levels to gain the same functionality. The compromise is that each prestige class focuses on a particular class ability or two rather than granting all of the class features normally associated with the class in question. So if you want a sorcerer that can rage or a fighter that likes to pick up the lute to inspire his friends on occasion, check out these new prestige classes.

186737.name: Sorcerous Origin: Dream Magic
186737.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don't dream it. BE it.

Tap into an innate magic that is entirely hypothetical, yet influences all that ever was, all that there is, & all that there ever will be. Purely fictional, Dream Magic is more powerful than anything in the world. For without it, mass & energy would be nothing but useless waste.

Dream Magic is a new sorcerous origin for your fifth edition sorcerer, including:

An entirely new specialty for your sorcerer to pursue
An expanded list of spells to bring your Dream Stuff to life
& 10 new metamagic options suitable for any sorcerer!

186738.name: Brainchild
186738.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don't let looks deceive you -- there's an evil mind in that adorable little girl's body. Not that the mechanized death machine she's driving would let you anyway. Run from Brainchild, longtime supervillain telepath and infamous sadist, his old body destroyed and currently trapped in the frame of the diminuative victim unfortunate enough to be his host. He's not happy and he's looking for targets to take that out on -- are you going to be one of them.

Brainchild is a PL 11 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

186739.name: Al Emmo's Postcards from Anozira
186739.description:
The Mayor of Anozira needs your help to drive tourists to the town! Explore the vast desert land and learn about the local stops and interesting wilderness areas as you use your Hidden Object skills to attract new people to the area and help local business survive. Explore the exotic world of the Wild West and discover a host of unusual treasures. (Okay, most of it's junk, but still...) Enter the homes of the town's many colorful inhabitants. Descend into the fabled Lost Dutchman's Mine and uncover riches beyond your craziest imaginings. Do all this and more as you challenge your perception and observation skills.

Select from 5 playable characters: Al Emmo, Rita Peralto, Kevin the Bartender, Koko the General Store Manager, or Mayor Herbie Trinkwasser. Choose to play casually in "relaxed" mode, or challenge your quick-thinking with the timer on. Dare you venture into the world of sand, sun, and silliness?

Source: The Developer Website.

186740.name: Rumemba
186740.description:
A memory game to frazzle the mind, a cross between memory game and rummy. 60 tactile counters, in 4 bright colours, numbered from 1-13, and 8 black counters can be used as anything.

Turn the counters face down and shuffle them around, arrange in a grid of 6 rows and 10 columns for easier play, leave random for harder play, suitable for 2+ players.

The active player turns over 3 counters of their choice, and the aim is to make a run of three consecutive numbers in the same colour, or a set of three numbers the same. If the numbers do not make a set or run, the counters are turned back over face down and the next player choices three counters to turn over, to make a set or a run. If a player turns over three counters making a set or a run, they take these from the middle and place them face up by themselves, and this gives them a score. The black counters have no numerical value, but can be used as anything to make up sets and runs with the other counters turned in a go.

The more counters you can rumemba which have been played, the greater your ability to make runs and sets. The counters all score for face value, and each player adds up the total number of points they have from the sets and runs they have won.

186741.description:
Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #4 includes two new heroes – with a miniature and character card for each hero. The new heroes introduced in this expansion are:

• Arcturus the Dragon Hunter: Arcturus gains bonuses to moving towards Dragons (and Dragonkin), for attacking Dragons, and even gets extra Hero Cards when slaying several Dragons at once.

• Tanya Cloudseeker the Dragon Rider: Tanya uses her connection with Dragons to fly with them, prevent their movement, and can also attack them efficiently for a cost.
186741.name: Defenders of the Realm: Hero Expansion #4

186742.name: EtymoLinguo
186742.description:
Do you really know the origins of the French language? Latin and Greek words are everywhere in the French language. With this family game, use Latin and Greek roots to find the corresponding French words. If you have for example MANUS, "hand" in Latin, you can find "manucure", "manual" or "manufacture". Depending on the difficulty or frequency derivative you will find, you score more points. No panic, no need to be a distinguished Latin or Greek scholar to participate! You just have to arm themselves with good humor and a competitive spirit! An addictive game for the whole family.
Etymolinguo, the game that revives the ancient languages!
Published in partnership with the site www.arretetonchar.fr

Material: 70 double-sided Latin/Greek cards, 1 hourglass, 1 pencil, 1 notebook

Rules of the game: the game master draws a card, reads the word (Latin and Greek) and his team will give as fast as possible French words derived from the Latin or Greek root. The more complicated is the word derivative, the more it gives points to his team.
Thus for GENUS ("species" in Latin), you can give: général (1 point), genèse (2 points), or gentleman (3 points).
The first team that reaches 15 points wins!

---

Connaissez-vous vraiment les origines du français ? Les mots latins et grecs sont partout dans la langue française. Avec ce jeu familial, partez des racines latines et grecques et trouvez les mots français correspondants. Si on vous dit par exemple MANUS, "la main" en latin, vous pourrez proposer « manucure », « manuel » ou « manufacture ». Selon la difficulté ou la fréquence du dérivé que vous trouverez, vous marquerez davantage de points. Pas de panique, pas besoin d’être un latiniste ou un helléniste émérite pour participer ! Il suffit juste de s’armer de bonne humeur et d’un esprit de compétition ! Un jeu addictif pour toute la famille.
Etymolinguo, le jeu qui ressuscite les langues anciennes !
Edité en partenariat avec le site www.arretetonchar.fr

Ce jeu d’étymologie est constitué d’un ensemble de cartes, d’un sablier, d’un carnet de notes et de son crayon.
Règles du jeu par équipe : le maître du jeu pioche une carte, énonce le mot (latin ou grec) et son équipe devra donner en un minimum de temps des mots français dérivés de ces racines latines ou grecques. Plus le mot dérivé est compliqué et plus il rapporte à son équipe.
Ainsi pour AMO ("aimer" en latin), on peut donner : amour (1 point), amant (2 points), ou amouracher (3 points).
La première équipe qui arrive à 15 points remporte la partie !

186743.name: Broadside
186743.description:
User Summary

In this game, you play a pirate trying to board vessels and more often, exchanging rounds of cannon fire. The controls are set a bit awkwardly, with Q and E being your broadsides and W and E setting and lowering your sails -- a little crowded in there with two hands-- but you can reset these keys as well. You gauge the wind to get the best advantage on pirate hunters and merchantmen, all the time trying to increase your infamy and prizes.

186744.name: Lalaloopsy: Ups 'n Downs 3D Game
186744.description: Be the first to reach the finish line and win, but beware the falling stars! 3-D Action adds to the traditional game play of Snakes & Ladders. Contents: 3D plastic playing board with pop-up dice in middle, 2 Detachable ladders & 4 Colored marbles. Fun from top to button. Lalaloopsy - Sew Magical! Sew Cute!

186745.name: Starlight
186745.description:
User summary:

Characters in Starlight have 9 to 12 Attributes: Strength, Health, Endurance, Perception, Agility, Dexterity, Will, Intelligence, and Communicate are always used. Fortune, Might, and Talent are optional Attributes to support various game options. Attribute Points are purchased from a pool. Characters then purchase Skills from a separate pool. Some Skills have limited usefulness outside of a specialty area. For actions, characters roll a pool of D6, with the number of dice determined by the Difficulty. Characters must "roll under" their Skill. The rules also present Powers, which are gained by super-heroes. However, most Powers are more akin to the effects of magic spells in fantasy systems than the types of super-powers found in typical super-hero games.

186746.name: Omega Basic Rules
186746.description:
User summary:

Characters in Omega have eight Attributes: Body, Coordination, Presence, Mindpower, Agility, Intelligence, Perception, and Wizardry. Attributes have a numeric rating from 1-8. Each Attribute is linked to two Skills. Skills have a Skill Level of 0-12. Skills also have up to three Modifiers: Area of Expertise, Expert Bonus, or Specialty Bonus. The Skill Value is the sum of its linked Attribute and the Skill Level.

Attribute numeric ratings are purchased from a point pool. Characters may "earn" some points by taking a Special Handicap. Skills Levels are purchased from a separate point pool. Again, characters may "earn" some points by taking a Duty or Flaw. Skills can be increased and must also be "maintained" by occasional expenditure of points.

Skills are used in Skill Resolution where the GM assigns a Difficulty Level from Routine to Absurd, representing 1 to 10. Characters roll that number in a dice pool, sum the dice, and subtract their Skill Value. The final result is compared to a Skill Action Table to determine outcome. Opposed actions work the same way but the Skill Action Table results are considered Intermediate. Both Intermediate results are compared on a second Action Table to determine the overall result.

186747.name: One Braincell
186747.description:
User summary:

Character creation in One Braincell is quite simple and involves generating narrative tags for Concept, Primary Ability, two Secondary Abilities, a Weakness, a Goal, and a Secret. When a non-trivial Task is attempted, the GM will determine the Difficulty of the Task and assign a number of specialized dice between 1 and 5, attempting to gain "successes" on the dice equal to the needed number. An optional Dilemma Dice can be used to add variability.

Characters may be given Plot Points which they may spend to gain momentary narrative control of the game--however, the GM can overrule the event if they desire.

186748.name: Card 'N' Go Seek
186748.description: Find it first, find it fast, find your fun! Card ‘N’ Go Seek is the game that delivers get-out-of-your-seat scavenger hunt fun for the whole family! At the count of three, everyone dashes off to retrieve an item revealed on one of the cards. The first player to get back with the correct type of item wins the matching card! Players have fun deciding for themselves what the cards mean. For example, finding something SWEET could be a lollipop or a picture of your great aunt Helen! Interpreting the cards really lets your personality shine. The first player to win one card of each color OR three cards of the same color wins the game! Every new environment invites new ways to play – the world is your game! Includes 150 cards, portable plastic case and instructions. Colors and decorations may vary.

186750.name: Hinterher ist man immer schlauer
186750.description: A normal trivia game with a twist: The first player gets 5 questions. He tries to answer them and he gets points - but he doesnt know which are answered correctly (just how many). If he hasn't answered all of them correctly, the next player gets THE SAME questions. etc. Until either everyone had a shot at these answers or all five questions are answered correctly.

186751.description:
Hera, tired of Zeus' infidelity, decides to take her revenge and releases the Titans on Mount Olympus. In the ensuing battle, the power liberated by the combatants ignites in a combustion that shatters the Earth. In the ensuing deflagration, the weakest gods are obliterated, rendered down into the small fragments of power that constituted their being. The stronger ones were able to resist total annihilation but even their prodigious power could not save them entirely. As the survivors fell from the broken mountain, the shards of their divinity and the remnants of those that did not survive were scattered to the 4 corners of a now broken world.

As they awoke, each god found themselves to be but a shadow of their former selves. They were still mighty, stronger than any mortal that yet walked but they were no longer all powerful, no longer immortal. Each one could sense the fragments of power that had now fallen to the Earth and that by collecting these they could regain their former grandeur and, if they could but amass enough, stand at the front of a new Pantheon, reshaped in their image.

The world around them suffered as much as they did, the power released during the epic battle had ignited a cataclysm that reduced the beautiful land of Greece to a barren wasteland. Athens burns, Crete has sunken below the waves of the roiling seas and the immortal mount Olympus is now an ash covered wreck of its former glory. But this Event has not only affected the mortal realms. The underworld trembled from the blow even as a legion of fresh souls ran down the river Styx. Would that have been the extent of the underworld's involvement however...

Hades, having lost the majority of his power, no longer holds sway over the Underworld. The gates of hell are open and even though the River Styx prevents the weakest souls from regaining the mortal world, the strongest warriors, the mightiest heroes and the most vicious monsters have managed to claw their way back up the Styx and back to the surface.

As a new power struggle breaks out, Gods summon mortal survivors, returned heroes and reborn monsters to their side in their hunt for the shards of their lost power.

In Mythic Battles: Pantheon, it is these clashes between warbands, in the midst of a post-apocalyptic ancient Greece, that are the focal point of the game. Choose your God, draft your warband and take the fight to your enemies with the might of the most powerful beings from Greek mythology at your back.
186751.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon
boardgameexpansion: Corinthia: a Conan – Mythic Battles crossover
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Arachne & Giant Spiders
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Artemis & Hounds of Artemis
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Circe & Circe's Wolves
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Forces of Nature
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Heroes of the Trojan War
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Jason & The Argonauts
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Oedipus Vs. the Sphinx
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Olympus in Ruins
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Paolo Parente Guest Box
Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Rise of the Titans
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 032 – Top 10 Designers
Episode 38 :: Haspelknecht Review + Academy Games Interview
Strange Assembly 203 - Mythic Battles
The Game Pit: Episode 77 - Picking Over the Bones

boardgameintegration: Brave and Noble Fights: The Battles of the Yalu and Wei-Hai-Wei, 1894-1895
Brave and Noble Fights: The Battles of the Yalu and Wei-Hai-Wei, 1894-1895
186752.description:
Brave and Noble Fights Expansion: The Battles of Foochow and Pung-do Island. This expansion game portrays the first battle of the 1894-95 Sino-Japanese War of Pung-do Island, and extends the period covered to the climactic battle of Foochow of the 1884 Sino-French War.

The historical Battle of Foochow can be played as a stand-alone game. However, to play the mini-game Battle of Pung-do and the many variants of Foochow and other “what if” battles of the Sino-French War you will need a copy of Brave and Noble Fights: The Battles of the Yalu and Wei-Hai-Wei.
186752.name: Brave and Noble Fights Expansion: The Battles of Foochow and Pung-do Island

186753.description:
Four Wizards is a new version of a classic card-shedding game. Players draw and discard their way to an empty hand, laying down a variety of cards designed around a medieval theme. Each deck comes with 72 cards and supports a game of 2-4 players. Included are 48 Medieval Unit Cards (4 Colored Factions: Blue Cross, Green Star, Red & Gold, and Purple Chevron).

In addition to the 48 Unit cards, there are 16 Wizards (4 different classes for each colored faction), and 6 Plague Cards. Plague Cards do not belong to any color; therefore, they cannot be discarded, ONLY PURGED. Plague Cards were created to prevent you from getting rid of all your cards. There are several ways to remove these cards from your hand (see Wizard Cards). Part of the fun is discovering these various methods of "purging" the Plague.

Wizard Cards are played in the same manner as the other Colored Units. For example, a Blue Wizard can be played on top of any Blue Unit or on top of any other Wizard. There are four types of Wizard Cards, each with their own unique action.

Swap-A-Hand Wizard - When you play this Wizard, swap your hand with the hand of another player. The choice of which player to Swap-A- Hand with is yours. Once the “swap” has occurred, play continues to the next player in turn.

Draw Two Wizard - When you play this Wizard, the next player must draw 2 cards. The player who draws the additional cards will still be able to play their turn. If they do not have a playable card after Drawing Two, they must continue to Draw until they draw a card that can be played. A turn is determined complete when a card has been played.

Purge-A-Card Wizard - When you play this Wizard, you may discard ANY card of your choice from your hand. Place the card of your choice facedown on the tabletop, thus removing it from the game completely. The card has now been PURGED.

Purge-The-Plague Wizard - When you play this Wizard, you may discard ONLY Plague Cards from your hand. However there is no limit to how many Plague Cards you can discard. Place the Plague Card(s) face up on the tabletop, thus removing it from the game completely. *The two "Purge" Wizard cards are the ONLY cards that can remove Plague Cards from your hand and therefore the game. Also important is the ability of the "Purge-A-Card" Wizard to remove ANY card from the game. The ability to remove Any card allows various opportunities to develop. In fact, sometimes the best play might not be to PURGE a Plague card. The choice is yours...
186753.name: Four Wizards

186754.name: Tinykeep
186754.description:
In TinyKeep players embrace the role of a hopeless prisoner held deep in a forgotten dungeon who one day wakes up to find themselves mysteriously released. Their savior is nowhere to be seen, but the cell door is broken and ajar, tempting them with the sweet scent of freedom. With nothing but a flickering lantern and a strange letter left behind by their in-mate, they must venture into the darkness and escape TinyKeep!

Lure monsters into traps, knock over fire torches to set furniture alight and set prisoners free to help you on your way. Enemies will work together in groups to hunt you down, and some will flee from threats. You can also take advantage of monster rivalries and lead them against each other, while you wait behind a corner as the resulting chaos ensues. There are many ways to survive in TinyKeep.

Features


Procedurally generated random dungeons – no playthrough is ever the same!
Watch your step as it can be your last! Extremely challenging Permadeath gameplay.
Explore a variety of beautiful but deadly environments. From the cold slimy walls of the dungeon to the hot fiery pits of hell, TinyKeep is a visual treat.
Battle a variety of intelligent enemies, each one determined to make your escape as difficult as possible. Creatures work together to chase you down, flee from threats and fight each other for dominance.
Use traps and environmental hazards to your advantage - fire, spike pits and rotating crushers hurt your enemies as well as you!
Collect coins from fallen foes to purchase random player-altering Buffs that just might give you the advantage you need to make it out alive.
Rescue other captives to fight along side you, but beware as you never know which ones have gone crazy trapped up in the Keep.
Experience 3 separate endings to the game, depending on how you play.
Hours of gameplay with secrets that extend the experience – discover items that can slow down time, render you invincible or provide secret saves.


Source: The Game Website.

186755.description:
Become a master Necromancer!

Cadaver is a card game in which players must use a variety of arcane resources to reanimate a series of cadavers. Each cadaver has a resource cost which players must spend to re-animate the corpse. Resources are drawn from a shared deck. One deck can be used by up to 3 players. Adding a second deck allows up to 6 players to compete for best necromancer!

Each player takes a number of cards from a single deck looking for corpses to reanimate, collecting arcane resources and accomplices, coffin locks and keys or terrifying ghouls. The player with the most corpses raised by dawn wins the game!
186755.name: Cadaver

186756.name: Yaochu!
186756.description:
User summary:
ヤオチュー! (Yaochu!) is a simplified Mahjong card game using only Ones, Nines, and Honour tiles to form an 8-card hand. Each player has 25 points at the start to take from each other. The game ends when all the players have taken turns to be the dealer twice or when a player's score drops to 0 points or below.

Publisher summary:
一九字牌だけの麻雀カードゲームです。
8枚のカードを揃える簡易版の麻雀カードゲームです。
それぞれ25点の点数を持って、点数を取り合います。
親が2周するか、誰かの点数が0未満になると終了です。

186757.name: Guerra de Letras
186757.description:
Is a game similar to battleship, but you must to discover the oponent words.
You have a card with some words and try to discover the words of your oponent.

By turns, each player says a letter of the alphabet (asks for only one letter in his turn) and the oponent, answer with all the locations of the word in his own card (example: player 1 says the letter "J" then, the player 2 answers "A3, B4, D1, etc").

Win the player that discover all the oponent words.

186758.name: Steam Controller
186758.description:
User Summary

Created by Valve, the Steam controller is intended to be a revolutionary input device for playing PC games, primarily through Steam.

It features dual trackpads, an analogue stick, two dual stage triggers, two shoulder buttons, standard A B X Y buttons, two grip buttons on the underside and a row of 3 control buttons, including one with a big steam logo.

186759.name: Opening the Dark
186759.description:
User summary:

The core task resolution method involves rolling a dice pool of d10, with the number of dice based on an identified character trait and Skill. Results of 7-9 count as one success and results of 10 count as two successes. If the number of successes meets or exceeds the target difficulty, the action succeeds. If no successes are rolled but the pool roll includes a 1, a critical failure has occurred. Impossible situations still allow a "faint hope" roll.

The GM will set a campaign type of either Heroic, Standard, or Gritty, and nearly all phases of character creation will be impacted by that decision because the various build points/options for every aspect are based on the campaign type. Character creation involves much background and personality development prior to generation of statistics. Attributes, ranging from 1-7+ (maximum human is 6) are grouped into three categories: Physical (Strength, Dexterity, and Constitutions); Mental (Intelligence, Senses, Wisdom); and Social (Attractiveness, Grace, and Charisma). Skills, also ranging from 1-7+ (maximum human is 6) are grouped into three categories: Informal, Formal, and Specialized. Combat can remain simple or involve a large variety of special situations and maneuvers.

186760.name: Appendix N Add-On #7: Grimic The Slaughterer
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
186760.description:
User summary:

A brief prospectus detailing a new god for Dungeon Crawl Classics. It includes basic information on the god, several ceremonies, and scenario ideas.

186761.name: Laro Chelle, The Ring Bearer
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
186761.description:
User summary:

A brief document outlining a Halfling Wizard, Laro Chelle.

It appears to share the same item number with Grimic The Slaughterer.

186763.name: OPUS: The One Page Universal System
rpg: OPUS: The One Page Universal System
186763.description:
User summary:

Character creation involves establishing a name and personal history and then selecting three Skills and three Items. Skills and Items may be anything agreeable to player and GM, though Skills should be concise and easily understood.

Non-trivial task resolution uses a die or dice pool rolled against the GM's or opponent's die or dice pool. The single highest die from each is compared and the highest one wins. Ties indicate a round of ineffective action. Generally, a single die is rolled. Appropriate Skills or Items add an additional die to the pool.

Characters begin each game session with three or more "Experience Dice" which may be added to the pool on any roll. Once used they are discarded for the remainder of the game session and are replenished on the next session. Characters that do well during a session are awarded an additional Experience Dice for the next session forward.

Combat involves grid movement and initiative. Combat is resolved in the same way as any action. Characters sustain three levels of hits; a fourth hit is lethal. The rules include the nice touch of a single-sentence option for Fantasy, Horror, and Space Opera genre implementation.

The rules typically are distributed with a dozen or so pre-generated characters.

186764.name: Sartar Campaign Pack
186764.description:
Publisher blurb:

We’ve put together a lovely little package of all the color maps, black and white maps, and the character and clan sheets from the Sartar Book. All the maps are full page sized.

186765.name: The Liquibot Experiment
rpg: OPUS: The One Page Universal System
186765.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 2709 A.D., and man has conquered the galaxy using faster than light drives and vast armies of AI robots. The mighty Solar Fedearation is, in truth, only a figurehead for the great interstellar corporations that control the Galaxy’s destiny.

Now, one of those Corporations, Blackstar Advanced Robotics, has made a major technological breakthrough. A liquid metal robotic design has been created, that will allow unprecedented battlefield infiltration and regeneration capabilities. Two high corporate executives and their staff are now taking the trade ship High Runner to a secret Federation testbed world, where the new robot design will be tested against captured alien xenomorphs. Unofrtunately, these break free on board ship and begin to rampage. The captain turns on the ship’s anti-hijack program, only to find that his robotic crew now grabs weapons and turns on the passengers. The captain, mate, and the two Federation Lords and their companions will have to find a way to stop the xenomorphs and shut down the robots, or else escape from the ship alive.

186766.name: The Vicissitudes of Venus
rpg: OPUS: The One Page Universal System
186766.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 1888, and man has conquered the solar system using void flying balloons and steamships. The travelers have flown to the steamy, jungle world of Venus to see the ancient temples, hunt dinosaurs in the swamps, or start new lives. However, a freak storm causes their passenger ship to crash in the jungles, some hundred fifty miles outside of port. They are the only survivors, and they have only been able to salvage two week’s food.

186767.name: Tarot Storia
186767.description:
User summary:
タロットストーリア (Tarot Storia) is a game for one player playing solitaire or for two players playing co-operatively. The game is published in a Japanese / English edition.

In the game, the player starts with one hand card, then draws a second. From these two, they play a card to the tableau. Cards are played touching, in columns left or right but shifted halfway up or down. In the one payer game, a column is restricted to 4 cards, in the two player, the limit is 3 cards. Alternately, you may exchange a played card with a hand card. But next turn, after drawing, you must play down two cards so your hand is back down to one before drawing.

Once all the cards are played, cards are turned face-down if any card on its right is of a lower number. Then the player tries to find paths in the tableau from the far left to the far right side. Think of this as telling the story. Any cards that are not part of a valid path are also turned down.

Now you score for colour groups, and deduct points for face-down cards and gaps in the tableau. After keeping a column, shuffle the deck over and play a second round to get your final score and the King's opinion!

For two players, it's the same with both players working a hand of two each. You cannot consult about which card to play, but after choosing, you may confer about placing. The final score this time reflects a test of your friendship.

Publisher's summary:
"You shall be rewarded if your tale amuses me."

The eccentric king issued the edict to all over the country. You are a bard who is willing to take up that challenge. You have to make up a tale by mixing stories in the world and enchant the king with the tale.

With beautifully illustrated 22 tarot cards with four background colours, this card game demands you make a succession of tough decisions. You will be excited to see how the storyline barely keeps consistency.

Basically, you play a card from two cards in your hand each turn. When you have played all cards, the first round ends and you score according to the card positions. With some of these cards remaining in play, the game proceeds to the second round in the same way. The total of two rounds is your final score.

Publisher's summary:
「わしを満足させる話が出来た者には褒美を取らせる」
変わり者の王様は国中にお触れを出しました。あなたはそれを聞きつけた名うての吟遊詩人。古今東西のお伽話をうまく繋いで、王様を魅了しましょう。

タロットカード（大アルカナ）の構成をそのままに、色の要素を取り入れることで選択が悩ましいカードゲームへ進化させました。お話がギリギリで繋がる綱渡りの連続にあなたは興奮を覚えることでしょう。

基本的なゲームの流れは２枚の手札の内、どちらを場に出すのか、の繰り返しです。カードを全て出しきった時にラウンドが終わり、配置に対し得点が出ます。１周目の配置を一部引き継ぎ、２周目が始まります。計２周した総得点があなたのスコアとなります。

186768.name: ORK: l'Ultime Outrage
186768.description:
User summary:

This French-language role-playing game finds players creating and running Orks as they try to survive in a dangerous world overrun by humans.

Characters have four Physical Attributes (la Puissance, l'Endurance, l'Agilité, and la Dextérité) and four Mental Attributes (l’Intelligence, la Volonté, la Perception, and le Charisme). Attributes have a narrative tag denoting their relative value, along with an associated numeric score that (for characters) typically runs from -4 to +4, with 0 being normal. Each Attribute has an associated table with performance notations and values that lie well outside of Ork norms. Characters also have Advantages and Disadvantages and Competencies (roughly analogous to Skills).

186769.name: Oroborus
186769.description:
User summary:

Oroborus was developed from the general rules of Ysgarth and To Challenge Tomorrow, with design goals of being a generic, universal system and being an easy-to-learn and use system. Note that Oroborus and Ysgarth characters are both playable in either rule system. The rules received substantial play-test and went through several major and numerous minor revisions. The final Version 2.8 was completed for publication (even receiving an ISBN) but has never been published. The rules included three major genre supplements which progressed through full development and cover art but likewise have never been published. These materials were freely and generally available online in HTML format until shortly before the planned publication date at which time they were removed.

Characters have four Mental Characteristics (Charm, Reason, Will, Creativity) and four Physical Characteristics (Constitution, Strength, Dexterity, Agility). Characteristics (Attributes) have a numeric score ranging from 1-24, with 11-14 being average. Characters have several Secondary Characteristics, most of which are derived. Characters also generate a list of Skills with associated Ratings. The Skills are detailed in two separate HTML pages; they are assigned to genre groups, and sometimes assigned to specific nationalities or time periods as well. Skills are usually divided into "secondary" applications and, particularly in combat, even further divided into "tertiary" applications. Characters may have specialized ability in a secondary or tertiary application.

Various "supplemental" abilities (psionic, magic, super powers) are grouped under Paranormal Skills. These Paranormal Skills have additional complications compared to standard Skills. The heavy support for these types of abilities indicates the system's investment in the fantasy genres. Combat is generally simple but does offer added complexity through numerous options and maneuvers. Actions in combat are limited by Action Points--each action has a cost and when the character runs out of Action Points their activity for the round is done.

186770.name: Birth of the Bogon
186770.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 2056. The world has witnessed great wars, famine, and a general state of decline. Technology and living standards are highly variable in most areas. Thu world political situation is a mess. Many nations fragmented after the Corporation Wars and the Flugen plague. Since then regions have split off in a process of Balkanization. In most cases, governments control more limited areas, or in some cases as little as a single city. The US, while technically controlling most of Canada and Central America, maintains an isolationist policy; trying to maintain interior control and limit the power of the corporations so that the Rise of the Syndics in 2017 will not be repeated. Several areas within the US have limited autonomy, notably the Republics of Texas and California.

186771.name: The Evil Brains
186771.description:
From the introduction:

It is the year 2010. Technology has advanced to the point where Optical Sensory Imaging Systems have made it possible for computer users to interract with their computers on a three dimensional, interractive level. This includes mentally exploring the vast computer network as if it were part of an alternate physical world. Some computer users have begun to live most of their lives online, even become addicted to the strange thrills the network has to offer, and some have staked out territory within the network and made it their own. The most organized and clearly defined development in this electronic world is the land of Cyberia, a loosely defined region within the North American section of the network which has developed its own political identity and a certain degree of autonomy.

186772.name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League – Collector's Box
boardgameexpansion: DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League
boardgameintegration: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn
Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Marvel Dice Masters: Uncanny X-Men
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn
Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Marvel Dice Masters: Uncanny X-Men
boardgamepodcastepisode: Diogenes Digital 3x07: Wonderboy 3 y DiceMasters
186772.description:
The DC Dice Masters: Justice League Collector’s Box is a great space to store your Dice Masters collection! It has a limited edition Full Art promo card and everything one player needs to get started! Improve and complete your team to crush the competition by collecting more cards and dice in foil packs and other sets!

Each DC Dice Masters: Justice League Collector’s Box contains:

20 custom dice
1 felt dice bag
10 Basic Action Cards
4 Indicator Cards
1 Full Art Promo Card
4 DC Dice Masters: Justice League Foil Packs
2 dice storage trays that hold over 300 dice
