This product aims to give you a monsters with a psionic flair with a single, detailed nemesis for cheap. Everything you need to use these monsters is included here.

Presented here is the monstrous creature: Greater Psionic Barghest

186874.name: Playing a Sidekick
186874.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sidebar #9 - Playing a Sidekick explores an interesting concept. What if you could play the familiar? The Animal Companion?

Throughout classic and modern fiction, “sidekick creatures” have been fan-favorites and come to center stage, now you can play as the sidekick, and let the humanoid be the NPC tagging along. Within you will find rules to play just that — the sidekick.You will find information on playing as a familiar, an eidolon, or even stranger creatures within. Even animal companions, with the Bonded Mount ability, get some attention (but these rules assume a certain minimum Intelligence is needed to play a sidekick as the main character).

186875.name: Gorged on Ruins (Pathfinder)
186875.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the eleventh adventure in the ZEITGEIST adventure path!

The World is Falling Apart

After the stars fell and the sun vanished, a new world order arose, controlled by a group known as the Obscurati. Now four nations are poised to assault the party's homeland, Risur. The only hope to avoid defeat is to convince the invaders that they have been tricked, for it was the Ob who truly cast the world into darkness.

It will take a great show of heroism to make them listen. But in a mix of fortunes, the departure of those vast armies have left the invading nations vulnerable to a series of great disasters back home - doomsdays the party might be able to avert. A wintry apocalyptic cult slaughters and brings anarchy. Cities go mad with eerie paranoia. An entire religion puts itself on trial for the sins of its god.

This is how the world ends: not with a whimper, but with multiple bangs and a giant lava dragon birthed from an erupting volcano.

An adventure for calamitous heroes of 19th level.

186876.name: NOD (Issue 27 - Oct 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Plan 9 From Outer Space: The RPG
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
186876.description:
From publisher blurb:

NOD is an RPG magazine with matieral compatible with most d20-based game systems, but with official stats for Blood & Treasure. NOD 27 features:

Gloriana's Blessed Isle, Part 2 - The continuation of the Ulflandia hex crawl that started in NOD 26
d20 Mecha I: The Classes - The first part of a three part article on adapting d20-based games for giant robot adventures
The Nodian Bestiary - Featuring 10 new monsters
Strength: A Primer - Exploring the strength ability score
The Muscleman - A new class that puts strength to the test
You Pull the Lever and ... - Ideas for lever-based traps and tricks
Racial Variations: Earth - Elemental twists on the classic fantasy races
Plan 9 from Outer Space: The RPG - A Quick & Easy minigame for Halloween
The Grey Planet Beckons - The negative-energy planet Pluto for NOD

186877.name: Kobolds
186877.description:
From publisher blurb:

Got bored with the normal version of a monster and fancy spicing things up a bit? Want to include imaginative and interesting versions of an iconic fantasy monster but don’t have the time to build the stat block yourself? Fear not – the 100% Crunch line is here to save the day! Each instalment in the line features dozens of ready-to-go stat blocks at a wide range or CRs of an iconic monster. This instalment of 100% Crunch presents dozens of kobolds (CRs 1/6-5) for the time-crunched GM to immediately utilise in game.

186878.name: Divine Elven Enchanter
186878.description:
From publisher blurb:

Learn the divine ways of the first elves!

The Divine Elven Enchanter is a variant elven class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, however you can play these divine elves in just about any OSR game. This class bring a new breed of elf to the game, one who wields divine magic instead of arcane power. Unlike most elves, the divine elven enchanter specializes in magic and casts an array of potent divine spells (as well as a few magic-user favorites). Their enticing personality is another arrow in their quiver, allowing them to talk their way past many obsticles and even briefly turn potential enemies into allies.

186879.name: POLARIS RPG - Core Rulebook: 1
186879.description:
POLARIS

"Humankind was born in the seas and is now coming back here to survive" - Vulrick the mad.

The Polaris RPG is set in a far future where the world aboveground has become uninhabitable for the human species. Human beings have found refuge in the depths of the ocean, where they try to somehow survive in spite of the many difficulties they encounter in this hostile environment.

In this new world of silence and darkness, players can choose to become agents of one of the underwater factions, mercenaries working to keep afloat, or freelancers trying to establish their own communities.

All these elements and many others make up the backdrop of this universe in which one great mystery prevails: The Polaris Effect.

"According to an old Hegemonian saying, it is in the ocean's darkness that you can really measure the courage of a man..."


POLARIS RPG is a french RPG that is finally coming to the US in 2016!

186880.name: The Suckering Worm
186880.description:
From Introduction:

Few adventurers know of the suckering worm. They never see it, never get that far into the monstrous underground world that lives beneath us — or never return, even if they do. But the monsters know the worms. They are famous, especially amongst the betting kind. For the suckering worms run the most famous and prestigious gambling ring in all the underworld.

The game is simple. Each monster brings a piece of treasure to the worms, to prove their ability. This buys them into the games. The worms allow newcomers to join a small group of other monsters. Each of them must go out and procure a single, valuable piece of treasure and present it at the group's next meeting. Whoever presents the most valuable treasure — decided by a secret vote — wins all treasure save the cheapest in value, which the worms keep as their share. Monsters who show some ingenuity and drive — whether they win or not — are allowed to join ever more prestigious groups of gamblers. Some crafty monsters have been able to amass hordes worth several mortal fortunes simply by risking a few choice pieces.

But all is not quite as it seems, for the suckering worm does not get its name for nothing. It well knows how to lure the foolish into its gluttonous maw, whether they be human or not. Their games are not rigged, for why should they care? They have already lured those who participate in their casinos in, they need only sucker them along until it is time to devour them. If a monster loses too many times, earning the contempt of others, it is easy enough to make them disappear without creating comment. And if a group of truly heavyweight treasure-thieves assemble and present to each other a horde of the ages… well, they too might disappear, along with all their ill-gotten gains. Even if word does get around, there are always more monsters to desperate and greedy to heed the warnings of their fellows.

186881.name: The Suckering Worm
186881.description:
From Introduction:

Few adventurers know of the suckering worm. They never see it, never get that far into the monstrous underground world that lives beneath us — or never return, even if they do. But the monsters know the worms. They are famous, especially amongst the betting kind. For the suckering worms run the most famous and prestigious gambling ring in all the underworld.

The game is simple. Each monster brings a piece of treasure to the worms, to prove their ability. This buys them into the games. The worms allow newcomers to join a small group of other monsters. Each of them must go out and procure a single, valuable piece of treasure and present it at the group's next meeting. Whoever presents the most valuable treasure — decided by a secret vote — wins all treasure save the cheapest in value, which the worms keep as their share. Monsters who show some ingenuity and drive — whether they win or not — are allowed to join ever more prestigious groups of gamblers. Some crafty monsters have been able to amass hordes worth several mortal fortunes simply by risking a few choice pieces.

But all is not quite as it seems, for the suckering worm does not get its name for nothing. It well knows how to lure the foolish into its gluttonous maw, whether they be human or not. Their games are not rigged, for why should they care? They have already lured those who participate in their casinos in, they need only sucker them along until it is time to devour them. If a monster loses too many times, earning the contempt of others, it is easy enough to make them disappear without creating comment. And if a group of truly heavyweight treasure-thieves assemble and present to each other a horde of the ages… well, they too might disappear, along with all their ill-gotten gains. Even if word does get around, there are always more monsters to desperate and greedy to heed the warnings of their fellows.

186882.description:
The Ascension Location Pack introduces a new card type to the Ascension Deck Building game. Locations can be shuffled into the center deck of any Ascension game. When they are revealed in a center row slot, they they permanently modify that slot to fundamentally change gameplay. Locations can change the cost of cards as well as create special events when a card in that slot is acquired or defeated. This promo pack is a great addition to any Ascension set.

This pack of thirteen cards contains doubles of Cetra's Shrine, Path Of Trials, Stone Circle, Hedron Sanctum, Rift's Edge and Arha Dojo plus a rules card.
186882.name: Ascension: Theme Pack – Location Pack

186883.name: The Red Skull Mercenary Company
186883.description:
From Introduction:

When your soldiers prove insufficient, when your armies are shattered by fearsome beasts or the humanoid hoards…
…if you still have money, there remains to you always:
a path to victory!

The Red Skull Mercenary Company will fight anyone, anywhere, as long as the price is right. Do you need wizards? Or warriors? Are your enemies holed up in cities, or giant fortresses? Fear not! The Red Skull Mercenary Company is famed across this land and so many others for its merciless siege engines! In addition, we have a plethora of experienced soldiers, magnificent mages, and skilled assassins. We can conquer any battlefield — FOR YOU!

A highly successful fighting company, the Red Skulls will work for nearly any employer, be they human, god, or monster. They desire only to live out their days surrounded by obscene wealth or to die in battle and dwell in Elysium forever. Their leaders have cultivated a sizeable organization of considerable variation, truly an organizational feat. Their representatives travel to conflict-torn areas offering their services, and can be found milling about in most major marketplaces of the world, especially the market in the woods.

It is entirely possible that independent adventurers might ant to hire trained mercenaries to aid them in the dungeon, once they have exhausted any local reservoirs of foolhardy torchbearers and stevedores, and found themselves in need of more competent help. The Red Skulls offer both human mercenaries and more expensive ogre fighters. You can imagine which is more in demand.

186884.name: The Red Skull Mercenary Company
186884.description:
From Introduction:

When your soldiers prove insufficient, when your armies are shattered by fearsome beasts or the humanoid hoards…
…if you still have money, there remains to you always:
a path to victory!

The Red Skull Mercenary Company will fight anyone, anywhere, as long as the price is right. Do you need wizards? Or warriors? Are your enemies holed up in cities, or giant fortresses? Fear not! The Red Skull Mercenary Company is famed across this land and so many others for its merciless siege engines! In addition, we have a plethora of experienced soldiers, magnificent mages, and skilled assassins. We can conquer any battlefield — FOR YOU!

A highly successful fighting company, the Red Skulls will work for nearly any employer, be they human, god, or monster. They desire only to live out their days surrounded by obscene wealth or to die in battle and dwell in Elysium forever. Their leaders have cultivated a sizeable organization of considerable variation, truly an organizational feat. Their representatives travel to conflict-torn areas offering their services, and can be found milling about in most major marketplaces of the world, especially the market in the woods.

It is entirely possible that independent adventurers might ant to hire trained mercenaries to aid them in the dungeon, once they have exhausted any local reservoirs of foolhardy torchbearers and stevedores, and found themselves in need of more competent help. The Red Skulls offer both human mercenaries and more expensive ogre fighters. You can imagine which is more in demand.

186885.name: Stadt Land Spielt Limitierte Sonderdrucke 2015
boardgamecompilation: Fliegen Klatschen: Rote Fliegenklatsche promo cards
Machi Koro: Fabrique de jouets du Père Noël
Solo: Protection, Change Direction and Gift cards
Speed Snacks: The Difficult Customer Promo Card
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
186885.description:
This package contains several promos and mini expansions:


Speed Snacks: The Difficult Customer Promo Card
Dominion: Prinz Promokarte (Dominion: Prince Promo)
Machi Koro: KOSMOS Shop (Machi Koro: Mega Gaming Store)
Machi Koro: Spielefabrik des Weihnachtsmanns (Machi Koro: Fabrique de jouets du Père Noël)
Fluxx: Büchse der Pandora Promo Card (Fluxx: Promo Cards)
Top Trumps: Space - 11 cards
Activity 4 - 11 cards
Port Royal: Gambler Promo Card - 4 copies
Abluxxen: Königskarten - 8 cards
Coloretto: +3-Karte - 2 cards
Tichu Proclamation Cards - 2 cards
Tutto: Sechsling-Karte - 2 cards
Mamma Mia: Joker-Zutat - 2 cards
Fliegen Klatschen: Rote Fliegenklatsche - 2 cards
Solo: Protection, Change Direction and Gift cards
Sushi Go: Punktezahl Karten (Point Counters)

186887.name: Valgkamp
186887.description:
Danish description:
Et spil om Mudder, Magt og Mærkesager

Valgkamp handler om at være den politiker der bedst leder sit parti gennem valgkampen.

Du bruger terninger til at erobre mærkesager, undgå skandaler og ikke mindst sværte de andre politikere til. Og ja, terninger er tilfældige, men det er politik også - selvom du gerne vil køre en velsmurt valgmaskine, kan det sagtens gå galt i sidste ende.

Dagsordener giver point, skandaler trækker ned, men du kan også få point hvis du klarer dit partis hemmelige mål. Den med flest point ender med at vinde og blive statsminister.

Translates to:
Election
A game about mud, power and agendas

Election is all about being the politician who can lead the party best through the campaign.

You use dice to take possession of agendas, avoid scandals, and to smear other politicians. And yes, dice are random, but so is politics - even if everything is running according to schedule, things can go wrong right at the last minute.

Agendas gives points, scandals deducts points, and you can get bonus points if you acquire your party's secret goal. Whoever gets most points wins the game, and is elected prime minister.

Gameplay:

Each turn the player throws the 6 dice. 1's can never be re-thrown, and are always bad, since three of those will give you a scandal. Three 6's can be used to throw mud at an opponent, which will give them a scandal. Everything in between cen be use to take control of agendas. Agendas require som combination of dice, like three 2's, or two 4's and two 5's, or many other Yatzee like combinations. Agendas give points, and some gives you special abilities. Agendas comes in five different themes, and some political goals is to acquire the most of a certain type, or many different types, or the least scandals or...

186888.name: Paradox Advanced Rulebook (Faight Industries)
186888.description:
From the introduction:

The Advanced Rulebook handles all the rules that you may need from time to time. From Optional Rules like Radiation and Diseases, to standard formula for developing Androids, Robots and Cybernetic Organisms (ARCOs); the advanced rulebook is there to help you with the technical specifications of your game.

User summary:

Characters have Attributes, Race, Boons and Banes, Class, Skills, and Resources. These statistics are intended to be subordinated to the Character Concept. To ensure the build matches the concept, several point pools are provided and the process of allocation follows a priority system. Attributes are grouped into Physics, Mental, and Spiritual categories, each having Stature, Might, Endurance, Reflexes, Dexterity, and Affinity. Numerous Secondary Attributes also are derived. The rules support several races, and present a list of Boons and Banes (advantages and disadvantages). Characters also select a Profession (class) and then allocate Skills.

186889.name: Quaffers
186889.description:
From the box:
It's about having fun whilst learning about wine! The board game is for 4 or more adults and key features include blind tasting and the testing of wine knowledge through answering "Experience" questions of varying levels of difficulty.

Each player is the owner of an internationally acclaimed vineyard. Each circuit of the board is a year in the life of their business and players must travel around the board to bottle their yield and sell their wine at market.

Each player will need to bring a bottle of wine, which they have to disguise from other players using one of the special Quaffers drawstring bags provided in the box.

To win the game, players can eliminate all others (survive without going bankrupt) or take over two other vineyards. Players vineyards are put up for sale when their wine is identified - "Taste or Bid" squares let the player have a go at identifying the masked bottle of wine that one of the players has brought to the party.

186890.name: Who's the Princess?
boardgameversion: Paul Lamond Games / Chimp and Zee edition
186890.description:
A fantastic educational game from the multi-award winning Chimp and Zee range of games and puzzles. Each child plays the part of a princess, who needs to collect a pair of shoes, a tiara, a ball gown, and an invitation. Once all the items are collected, the player places them in their own coach, in order to be the first to go to the ball but each player needs to watch out for the wicked queen. The first player to collect all 4 cards and get back to their castle space is the real Princess. This game is great fun for children and easy for parents to explain. This game can help children learn through play. Easy to set up you can start playing in just a few minutes and everyone has a chance to win. Only takes ten minutes to play and is even great fun when it's not your turn.

Who's the Princess was created to help children with colours, shapes, matching, and co-ordination along with developing the ability to play together. The game is presented in a quality cardboard carton complete with carry-handle and glitter printing. This game is for 2 - 4 players and suitable for ages 3 years and over.

186891.name: Paradox Basic Rulebook (Faight Industries) Version 2
186891.description:
From the introduction:

The Paradox Basic Rulebook is separated into six chapters, Introduction, Game Play, Resolving Game Play, Magic, Equipment, and Appendixes. Due to the progressive ideas in the paradox system, all players and the Gamemaster should read these sections, even if they are experienced with other game systems. Each section attempts to convey the feel and simplicity of the Roleplaying system; however, there may be some spots that will confuse players. To help you along, Faight Industries offers a Facts Forum (FF) to all registered users. All you need to do is register the Paradox rules and you will be eligible for all the benefits of registered users, including support.

The Basic Rulebook handles all the rules that Players need to be familiar with in order to enjoy the game. As they become more familiar with the system they may wish to explore the more expanded rules of the Advanced Rulebook. The Advanced Rulebook includes many of the formula and creation utilities used to create the items in the Basic Rulebook.

186892.name: Paradox Basic Rulebook (Faight Industries) Version 3
186892.description:
User summary:

The Paradox Basic Rulebook, Version 3, is published in "tablet" format with smaller pages which partially explains the more-than-double page count from the previous version. It retains the same six-chapter organization and most of the text from the previous edition.

Character generation includes the selection of a Profession (class), then to Boons and Banes (advantages and disadvantages). Characters generate Attributes, which have been reduced to fifteen, still places into three groups: Physical, Mental, and Spiritual. Finally, Skills are selected and assigned a Level. There are two character creation mechanisms--a Basic Method, which follows a prescribed pathway, and a general free-form method which is for experienced players. Character generation software is provided for players who wish to use it instead of performing a hand-build.

186893.name: Paradox Basic Rulebook (Faight Industries) Version 4
186893.description:
User summary:

The Paradox Basic Rulebook, Version 4, is published only as online HTML; in several places it is referred to as a "beta" release. Several sections have been added to the Version 3 presentation but many of these new sections remain as stub entries only. The primary addition involves the "Realms", or meta-setting, for the game, though only the Spiritual Realm is fully defined. Additional material clarifying some aspects of action resolution are also provided.

186894.name: Paradox Character Generator (Faight Industries)
186894.description:
User summary:

The Paradox Character Generator is provided as an Microsoft Excel spreadsheet that is used to partially generate a character by using user-entered data fields and formulas to populate derived values. Two implementations of the generator are provided, one for Version 3 of the rules and one for Version 4 of the rules. Although the Version 4 is an incremental improvement it is a substantive improvement, with numerous supporting data sheets available to assist in more-complete character generation and, optionally, to allow for customization of the generator itself.

Note the Version 4 of the generator is distributed in a ZIP archive with the XLSM file and a folder containing about fifty pre-defined characters.

186895.name: Planet Zoom
186895.description:
First complete the puzzle about different terrains and vehicles.
Then take turns matching the different modes of transport to the correct categories.
Who has placed the most tiles to the correct categories is the winner.

186896.name: Pocket Battleship
186896.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a compact pocket battleship designed to saturate enemy point defence with devastating torpedo volleys.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

186897.name: Home Free
186897.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

You are a dog lost in a randomly generated city. Use your canine abilities to explore.

186899.name: Sulerin
186899.description:
User summary:

Sulerin is a rich, detailed fantasy campaign setting presented in free HTML format. There are several major HTML components of the site, including:


Atlas (Languages, Multiverse, Timeline)
Campaigns (Characters, Modules)
Creatures (Index, Encounter Builder)
Religions
Personalities
Magic Items
Lore & Stories
Rule Additions (Feats, House Rules, Prestige Classes, Races)
Spells (Domains)
Links


In addition, the site has an associated forum, a subscription-based e-mail newsletter, a guestbook, and updates summary, and a search function. The Atlas includes numerous interactive, full-color, richly-detailed maps.

186900.name: The Prison of Niosha
186900.description:
From the introduction:

This fortress was the center of power for a vampire cult dedicated to the fallen goddess called Niosha, who was cast from the heavens for her predilections upon other young gods. Entrapped nearby is the remnant of one of her deity lovers who also fell from grace, Ravadin, set to guard the tomb. Since the arrival of Madrasheen, a powerful devotee of Niosha, the power of Ravadin has diminished even further to barely a whisper.

User summary:

The upper levels of the prison are suitable for mid-level adventurers (approx. 11th level). The lower levels of the prison require a high-level party.

186901.name: Tomb of Yearon
186901.description:
From the introduction:

The Tomb of Yearon is an adventure for designed for four 8th to 10th level player characters. It is advisable that the party retains the services of a rogue, a less diverse party of characters may have trouble surpassing some of the puzzles within.

The Tomb of Yearon was created as a starting point for a campaign in which the player characters recover the first part of a three part magic item. It could just as easily guard any number of special magic items.

Players should be able to complete the Tomb in an evening. The module is short enough to use as a sidetrack adventure or as part of a larger storyline.

186902.name: Aurion: Legacy of Kori-Odan
186902.description:
It is the first genuinely original game from west Africa. The story follows a young prince in Zama named Enzo, who is ambushed overthrown and exiled from his palace in a coup led by his embittered brother-in law moments before his coronation to the throne as King of Zama as well as his Marriage to Erine of Soma.In order to regain his throne, the two must embark on a quest seeking help from the other countries, forming an alliance (some of which involve initiation rituals) to defeat his brother in law, and restore the throne, and save their kingdom.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aurion Legacy of Kori-Odan", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

186903.name: Hopalong
186903.description: It´s a Pachisi-Ludo variant where your pawn can land on a another piece and get a free ride if that other piece moves. If the double-stack lands on a piece or another piece moves on the the double-stack, then the lowest piece have to move back to that color's starting-space. A piece also has to move back to the starting-space if it moves along in another color's safety-line in the end of the road. The first player to get all four pawns in the center wins.

186904.description:
The Animal Games is a light-hearted card-based party game for 3-6 players based on the following theme:

Players have attained super-stardom and handsome riches over many years due to their innate ability to communicate with and to train animals of all different species. Now the greatest animal trainers from around the world (the participating players) have gathered for the ultimate test of their training prowess - The Animal Games.

Three events are first selected - one from each of five different categories (speed, power, endurance, technical and team). These events can be any measurable activity, examples including the 100m sprint, high jump, ballroom dancing and hide-and-seek. Players are then dealt a hand of animal cards to choose from and must select one single animal to represent them across all three events, competing against the animals selected by the other players. These events are then played out by way of animated discussion and players then vote according to their opinion on the likely rankings. Votes score points for the appropriate players and the player with the most points after three events wins.

The Animal Games combines the fun and laughter of a conversation-driven party game with the challenge of strategic thinking required for animal selection and event tactics.

Who will be your champion?
186904.name: The Animal Games

186905.description:
For ages 8+
2-6 players

Monopoly: Pokémon Kanto Edition is a special edition of the classic Monopoly game adapted towards Pokémon, with focus on the Kanto region. It is the third version of Pokémon Monopoly and is based on Pokémon FireRed/LeafGreen and Pokémon Origins.


Pokémon themed game board features the Kanto Region and all 8 gyms
Includes 6 collectible metal tokens: Pikachu, Bulbasaur, Charmander, Squirtle, Eevee, Jigglypuff
Custom sculpted Poké Marts and Pokémon Centers replace traditional Houses and Hotels
Professor Oak and Trainer Battle Cards replace Chance and Community Chest Cards
Custom Pokémon Money replaces original Monopoly bills


From the publisher:
Join Pikachu and friends on an adventure through the Kanto Region! In this special Pokémon: Kanto Edition of Monopoly you'll travel through all eight gyms and battle Gym Leader Pokémon. Trainer Battle and Professor Oak cards might reward you for Pokémon encounters, or bring an unexpected surprise. Buy, sell and trade with other Pokémon Trainers to get a powerful Pokémon team and win the game!
186905.name: Monopoly: Pokémon Kanto Edition

186906.name: Funny Bunny Rhyming Game
186906.description:
Find two bunnies with words that rhyme. Remember where they are, it's memory time! 2 levels of play.

Includes:
4 double-sided game cards
40 bunny cards
Activity guide

Players put the 40 bunny cards in the middle, face down. Each player takes a game card which has 4 spaces for bunny cards. Players each draw a bunny card and place it on their game card. This is the word they must rhyme. Players take turns turning over a bunny card. It if rhymes with their first word, they add it to their game card. If not, they turn it back over. The other players may turn this same card over if it rhymes with their word, or they may turn another card over. First player to fill their card with 5 words that rhyme, wins.

186908.name: Paths of Virtue
186908.description:
User summary:

Paths of Virtue is distributed as a series of eight PDF files. The distribution documents include character creation and action resolution, in addition to a cybernetic equipment guide. Also, the game provides a substantial amount of setting detail that support the rules. The character build process is somewhat setting dependent but could be utilized without the campaign specifics.

Characters have eight Stats (attributes): Psyche, Strength, Constitution, Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, Perception, and Physical Beauty. The Stats have values assigned by one of several methods, all involving dice. They range from 2 to 24. Once Stats are randomized, the remainder of the build uses Character Points. Skills are purchased and assigned a Level (which cannot exceed 30). Spell-casting is a Skill. Flaws and Powers are then selected. Powers also have a Level assigned and a narrative rank (Weak, Intermediate, or Great). Any remaining Character Points can be spent on a variety of other advantages such as contacts or resources.

Combat requires an Action Declaration from players before the round begins. Attacks require a d100 roll under the character's "To-Hit Value" (a derived value). Some characters with high Dexterity may receive more than one attack per round. Because combat often involves melee weapons, firearms, spells, and tech weapons, it is fairly complex and involves numerous rules covering special circumstances. Any damage is applied to a randomly-determined hit location and reduced by armor.

186909.name: Indivisible
186909.description:
The game follows the story of Ajna, a girl who embarks on a global journey to discover the truth behind her mysterious powers. During her quest, she is joined by a variety of unique heroes, gaining new abilities to traverse different environments and defeat enemies encountered along the way.

Source: Wikipedia, "Indivisible", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

186910.name: Wirehead's Guide to the 30's
186910.description:
User summary:

The game documents of Paths of Glory define several components of the game's setting. However, most of the flavor and many of the unique aspects of the setting are detailed in Wirehead's Guide to the 30's (that's the 2030's). It is presented as a type of commentary or travelogue, though it does contain some game data.

186912.name: Curse of the Yellow Sign
186912.description:
(from the back of the book)

H.P. Lovecraft was inspired by many authors. One of them was Robert Chambers, a storyteller with a profound sense of the macabre. Curse of the Yellow Sign contains three stories in the tradition of Chambers, the creator of the infamous Yellow Sign and the cursed play, The King in Yellow.

The complete Curse of the Yellow Sign contains all three of the original adventures, completely revised and updated.

186913.name: Chrononauts: Carl Sagan's Joint
186913.description:
This is a one-card expansion. From the Looney Labs website:

This special Artifact works in either type of Chrononauts deck.

It debuted as a promo card for the Summer Festivals of 2004.

The text on the card says, "At any time during your normal turn, if you have this Artifact in play, you may (as an extra action) swap it with any Artifact or Gadget another player has on the table."

186914.name: Chrononauts: Mating Pair of Pterodactyls
186914.description:
This is a one-card expansion. From the Looney Labs website:

This special Artifact works in either type of Chrononauts deck.

It debuted as a promo card at Dragon*Con 2004.

It says, "Counts as any one Live Dinosaur, or a mating pair of Dodo Birds."

186915.name: Pathwanderer Rôle-Playing System
186915.description:
User summary:

The rules are freely distributed as three downloadable PDF files of 20, 20, and 26 pages. Characters have ten Statistics, including: Strength, Dexterity, Physique, Mental Agility, Intuition, Charisma, Resolve, Height, Weight, and Appearance. Statistics have a numeric value ranging from 21-90. The numeric value can be either randomly generated or purchased with a point allocation system. Characters have Skill Bases which is a rating for a type of Skill. The Skill Bases available to a character depend on culture and professional background. Character development is handled through Statistic and Skill enhancement.

Skills are resolved using d100 and adding any bonuses. However, the rules include several types of other rolls for specific situations or tasks and many of these vary in detail. Combat is complex and involves numerous modifiers and special situations and maneuvers.

186916.name: Eireann and the Isle of the Mighty
186916.description:
User summary:

Eireann and the Isle of the Mighty is a setting (or "World Unit") for the Pathwanderer Rôle-Playing System. It presents the British Isles during the time known as the Dark Ages, from the end of the Roman invasion in Britain to the beginnings of England as a united country. The setting presents an alternate history where legends are real. It is the age of Merlin and Arthur, of Hengist's early Saxon settlements of Vortigern's Tower and of the wars of the vigorous pagan king Penda. It is an age of magic. The islands are home to a vast number of Druids, monsters, warriors, and gods. Campaigns can be set in Eire (Eireann) and/or Britain (Ynys Prydein, the Isle of the Mighty) in any period from 410 - 796 AD. In addition to the setting details, the document provides "tweaks" that should be made to the core rules to allow campaigns to function smoothly.

186917.name: Pathwanderer Character Generator
186917.description:
User summary:

The Character Generator for the Pathwanderer Rôle-Playing System is provided in a number of versions and formats. All of them produce a similar end-product. The spreadsheets use embedded formulas to auto-populate derived values and auto-calculate several complex areas of character generation. Cells in the spreadsheet are color-coded to indicate which are to be used as input fields. The spreadsheets do a creditable job of completing the bulk of the work of character generation but hand-finishing probably will be required for characters.

The spreadsheet is provided in these formats, all available for free download:


Microsoft Excel 2000 & 97 (A4 Format)
Microsoft Excel 2000 & 97 (Letter Format)
Microsoft 95 & 5.0 (A4 Format)
Microsoft 95 & 5.0 (Letter Format)
Microsoft 4.0 (A4 Format)
Microsoft 4.0 (Letter Format)
Lotus 1-2-3 '97 (A4 Format)
Lotus 1-2-3 '97 (Letter Format)
PDF traditional print-and-use (A4 Format, 4 pages).

186918.name: Top
186918.description: Each of the 2-4 players control 3 pins carrying replaceable tokens. There are 12 tokens numbered from 1 to 12. The players move their pins on the board horizontally, vertically or diagonally. When 2 pins from 2 different players are located diagonal next to each other their tokens can be exchanged. The game ends when all pins reached their destination. Each player sums up the values of the tokens his pins are holding. The winner is the player which has achieved the highest sum.

186919.name: Hangtown: The Tailings Pile
186919.description:
The Tailings Pile expansions pack adds new character roles into Hangtown, such as the the Rustler, Town Drunk, Madame, Foreman, and Desperado.

It also includes The South Fork, which is an additional worker placement board. The back side of it has a final scoring aid.

You must have a copy of Hangtown in order to use this expansion. It is not a stand-alone game.

186920.name: Golem Arcana: Urugal – Ashmogh Colossus
186920.description:
It is said that the bones of the past should have been left alone, but these are desperate times and thus desperate measures were taken.
The Ashmogh was resurrected from the ashes of an Urugal necropolis long buried under the desert sands, and now people wonder if it wasn't buried with good reason.
The reckless indiscrimination with which the Ashmogh destroys both friend and foe in its hunger for destruction leave many Urugal wondering if the old ways were not in fact better left resting in the dark.

The Ashmogh comes with two new Relic Cards:

The Seal of Kanak cripples the magic of enemy or allied Knights to heal the Colossus
The Storm's Eye pulls Golems inexorably closer

186921.name: Bob the Builder: Can We Fix It?
186921.description:
From the back of the box:
Can we fix it?
Yes we can!
Join Bob the Builder and his team of friends in thirteen "Fix It Fun" activities featuring all of your favorite characters, voices and music from the popular TV show.

186922.name: Arslan: The Warriors of Legend
186922.description:
User Summary

Arslan: The Warriors of Legend is based on the novel, The Heroic Legend of Arslan, and aims to stick close to the spirit of the rebooted anime and manga versions. The series tackles themes of slavery, religious fanaticism, and humanity.

186923.name: 6 Takes!
186923.description:
6 takes! - Wolfgang Kramer's ingeniously simple card game with "bullheads" - now as an app.

The aim of the game is to avoid getting cards. Each card you have to pick up costs you points for each bullhead on it. The player with the fewest bullheads at the end of the game is the winner. It sounds easier than it is, players will need some great tactics and perhaps a little luck.

6 takes! is regarded as a modern classic among card games and has been sold all over the world. It has won the German "Games Prize" and has also been nominated "Game of the Year".

Source: The Publisher Website.

186924.name: Amelie's Cafe
186924.description:
User Summary

A time management game where you are trying to build a restaurant. You need to prepare and deliver the food, manage employees and satisfy the customers. You can upgrade the restaurant using mini-games.

186925.name: Flip Flop
186925.description:
Flip Flop is trick taking game in which players must complete objectives to score points. But... beware !
The cards are double-sided with different values on each side, each player sees the reverse of the other players' hands and can have them flip-flop their hand to completely change the course of the game !

186926.name: The Flintstone Kids Game
186926.description:
Yabba Dabba Doo! It's Rock 'n' Rolling Stone Age Fun!

The Flintstone Kids Go To The Bedrock Concert. Includes Board, 4 Die Cut Figures & Stands, 4 Die Cut Skateboards, 2 Deck of 54 Cards (27 Skateboard On & 27 Skateboard Off)

Players move on the board by drawing cards and following the instructions. Players begin with the skateboard off. Players draw from the Skateboard Off cards until they are instructed to put on the skateboard. (Slip the skateboard over the head of the figure to put the skateboard on) Once on the skateboard, they draw from the Skateboard On cards. Winner is the first to reach the Bedrock Concert.

186927.name: Frost Ruins
186927.description:
From publisher blurb:

The blasted frozen wastes of a ruined city. The walls and towers are no more; the only evidence of this once mighty settlement is cracked and worn stone beneath the ice.

Need a skirmish map for a wargame? Large scale exploration in an RPG?

A printable battlemap for RPG games or wargames such as Warhammer, Frostgrave and Mordheim. Add 3D terrain and use the map as a battle surface. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 50 x 50 map depicting a frozen ruined city surface, complete with frost, cracked stone and scrawny trees. Use the full map, or crop and print sections to use.

File formats are:
250dpi pdf with both gridded and ungridded versions
250dpi full size jpg (gridded and ungridded), for poster printing or VTT.

186928.name: Kovana Rybakov
186928.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

Snapshot Statement

Kovana is a lawful good female human with wizard levels using the metal elementalist elemental school. She excels in electricity magic as well as enhancement spells to aid herself and allies.

186929.name: Fighters (PRD)
186929.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game offers a vast range of options for characters of all classes. This is great when a player wants to explore variations on a theme, but it comes at a cost: the character options for each class have been published across many places.

Books (hardcover compilations such as Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ and Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game: Ultimate Combat™, plus the various companions, adventures, and chronicles);
PDFs (from Paizo and from third-party publishers);
Websites, blogs, and other online sources.




This can be intimidating to new players, and inconvenient to experienced players. The Echelon Reference Series aims to make this easier for everyone by gather information for each class into a single book.

Echelon Reference Series: Fighter collects information about the fighter class. The fighter base class and fighter archetypes. Fighters don’t have class features to choose from such as rage powers, but they do get bonus combat feats every other level… so this book has all of them that I could find. There are also over 80 stat blocks for NPCs of all levels and many races.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

186930.name: Fighters (3PP)
186930.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game offers a vast range of options for characters of all classes. This is great when a player wants to explore variations on a theme, but it comes at a cost: the character options for each class have been published across many places.

Books (hardcover compilations such as Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ and Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game: Ultimate Combat™, plus the various companions, adventures, and chronicles);
PDFs (from Paizo and from third-party publishers);
Websites, blogs, and other online sources.




This can be intimidating to new players, and inconvenient to experienced players. The Echelon Reference Series aims to make this easier for everyone by gather information for each class into a single book.

Echelon Reference Series: Fighter collects information about the fighter class. The fighter base class and fighter archetypes. Fighters don’t have class features to choose from such as rage powers, but they do get bonus combat feats every other level… so this book has all of them that I could find. There are also over 80 stat blocks for NPCs of all levels and many races.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and selected third-party products.

186931.name: The Demonologist
186931.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Demonologist base class is a new hybrid class by Total Party Kill Games. The Demonologist is a master of the infernal arts, a summoner of great power, who uses not eidolons, but demonic servants. He wields the dark arts like a witch, capable of maelific hexes that bind mortals and demonic ilk alike.

Within these pages lie a fantastic new class that is both fun to play and who could make a truly challenging villain unlike any other in your repertoire.

This 20 level base class comes complete with 30 new hexes, new archetypes like the Fiendflesh Disciple, the Infernal Traitor, the Sacrifist, the Rakshasa-bound Zakyas, plus 23 new feats, new spells and magic items!

Do not bow to evil, make it bow to you!

186932.name: 20 Infernal Feats
186932.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do I smell brimstone? Inside this edition of Feats of Legend is 20 new infernal feats. These feats are designed for use with any character looking to deal with the lower planes. Master hellfire, learn to fight like a Kyton, shoot unholy bullets or pledge your mortal soul for a a taste of power.

186934.name: Hive (1986)
186934.description:
User Summary

Hive is a game with vector graphics by Firebird. The player is flying into a tunnel with a combat craft, a electro-mechanical grasshopper. The aim is to fight the waves of enemies, and to get to the center of the hive. The player wins the game by terminating the queen.

186935.description:
Promo Expansion for the game Bomarzo: Shuffle the 12 Season tokens, then randomly take 1 token and put it on the Game board near the first Season number. Repeat the procedure for each Season number on the board until 8 tokens have been placed. Give to each player a Resume card.
Each season, a modification is applied based on the color of the token for that season:
White token: No modification.
Black token: Villages do not have a Production Phase for this season.
Green token: A maximum of 2 actions per player are allowed.
Yellow token: Divinity action copying is not allowed.
Brown token: Card powers/incomes do not work.
186935.name: Bomarzo: Seasons

186936.description:
Shuffle the 8 Worship cards and place the deck near the board. Each card represents a Divinity. During their turn, players can take 1 card from the Worship deck plus 1 additional card for each 2 resources (any type) paid to the reserve. Players can keep only 1 card from those drawn, and the others must be put back (reshuffle the Worship deck). Keep the card hidden from the other players.

At the end of the game, a Worship card is considered accomplished if the player who holds it won his corresponding category. For each accomplished card, a player gains 3 VPs. For each card that is not accomplished he loses 1 VP.
186936.name: Bomarzo: Worship

186937.description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these. There are hikes and flights in addition to the train rides.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets. There are also facilities to gain double points.
186937.name: Corsica (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

186938.name: Polaris Universe: Quick Start Overview
186938.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world aboveground has become uninhabitable, humankind was forced to flee from the surface and find shelter in the seas. They are now trying to survive in this hostile environment. Dealing with the species' degeneration, perpetual wars, monsters and very limited ressources. And there is this great mystery that prevails: the Polaris Effect...

POLARIS is a french tabletop RPG, set in an post-apocalyptic sci-fi atmosphere, where survival is key. POLARIS will soon be available in english, get a first glimpse at the setting with this free PDF!

This PDF contains:

An introduction to POLARIS RPG
A brief overview of the setting
Two complete archetypes

186939.name: Polaris Quick-Start Rules
186939.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world aboveground has become uninhabitable, humankind was forced to flee from the surface and find shelter in the seas. They are now trying to survive in this hostile environment. Dealing with the species' degeneration, perpetual wars, monsters and very limited ressources. And there is this great mystery that prevails: the Polaris Effect...

POLARIS is a french tabletop RPG, set in an post-apocalyptic sci-fi atmosphere, where survival is key. POLARIS will soon be available in english, get a first glimpse at the setting with this free PDF!

This PDF contains:

The basic rules system in a simplified version
A preview of the Polaris Effect and three Polaris Powers
Two complete archetypes
The basic weapon list

186940.name: Univers
186940.description:
From publisher blurb:

Univers est le premier supplément de background pour Polaris, Troisième édition. Ce beau bébé compile les informations (mises à jour) des suppléments sorties pour les précédentes éditions du jeu (Hégémonie, Ligue Rouge, Surface, Pirates et Volcania III qui n'avait jamais vu le jour en version papier).

Vous découvrirez quels mystères cachent la nation hégémonienne et son ennemi héréditaire, la Ligue Rouge. L'activité des pirates du globe n'auront plus de secrets pour vous et il vous sera même possible de proposer une petite excursion sur les terres mortes et irradiées de la surface. Enfin, la cité indépendante Volcania III pourra aisément servir de base pour votre groupe de PJ, loin de la surveillance des Veilleurs...

Vous trouverez dans ce livre :

toutes les informations de background nécessaires pour développer vos propres aventures en Hégémonie, Ligue Rouge, Surface et dans les eaux menacées par les confréries pirates
la description complète de la cité indépendante de Volcania III
toutes les règles de jeu de survie en surface et de création de personnages venant de l'enfer terrestre
un index de tous les PNJ présentés dans le supplément
deux nouvelles cartes en couleur du globe terrestre





Translation courtesy of Google:

Universe is the first supplement for background Polaris, Third Edition. This beautiful baby compiles information (updates) supplements outputs for the previous editions of the game (hegemony, League Red, Surface, Pirates and Volcania III that had never emerged in print).

You will discover what mysteries lurk hégémonienne the nation and its hereditary enemy, the League Rouge. The activity of pirates in the world will have no secrets for you and you will even be possible to offer a short excursion on dead land and irradiated surface. Finally, the independent city Volcania III could easily serve as a basis for your group of PJ, away from the supervision of the Vigil ...

You will find in this book:

all the background information needed to develop your own adventures Hegemony, League Red Surface and waters threatened by pirates brotherhoods
full description of the independent city Volcanus III
all surface survival game rules and character creation from the earthly hell
an index of all the NPCs presented in the supplement
two new color maps of the globe

186941.name: Kama Sutra Memory
186941.description:
Kama Sutra Memory is an adult memory game that teaches you about the Kama Sutra. The game can be played worth or without clothes on.

The game includes 48 cards and is played as a conventional memory game, but also have three official variants:

Variant 1 - The Quick One
For two players. 12 sets - ignore text.
The cards are placed face down and is turned in pairs, like any other memory game. If the cards are not the same (= two different KS positions), the player have to pick one of them and the players have to try to do this position. If it is a match the cards are removed without any trial.
Most collected pairs win.

Variant 2 - The Crash Course
2 players. 12 sets - use text, ignore points.
This game is played reversed than above; the 24 cards are placed face down, but this time the tasks first come when a match is found; on each card is a text and as a pair they make a task, which have to be tried out.
Most collected pairs wins.

Variant 3 - The Super Orgie
2 or more players. All cards and texts in use.
In this variant the players flip over four of the 48 face down cards; when there is a match, the talks are read and have to be followed.
Each set of four cards is worth 50 points and each completed task gives points. The player with most points win.

186942.name: Lock Dice
186942.description:
A dice game that simulates competitive lockpicking.

Players will contribute dice ("pins") to a lock in the center of the table, and then will take turns attempting to pick the lock by matching die rolls. As the game goes on, the player's skill and tools increase, allowing for faster and more efficient picking.

186945.name: Over Powered Arena
186945.description:
O.P. Arena is a battle royale of epic proportions. The game includes over 80 unique characters that are all over powered. Players use them destroy each other, and earn victory points.
Kill a dude and you get 3 VP. Have the most damage on a dude when he kicks the bucket, you get 2 VP. Have the second most damage, gain 1 VP.

Don't get too attached to your dudes. They will die. Quickly. No worries though, you'll get new ones to carry on the fight.

Players can earn tokens to nerf other dude's abilities, shields to protect abilities, and tokens to allow re-rolls.

Fight until a player reaches 20+ VP and they are the winner.

Cthulhu Vs. Helpless Bunny? Expansionist Alien Vs. Paladin? Cole-fired Robot of Doom Vs. a Little Girl? Rabid War Bear Vs. Animated Chicken Bone? Goat Vs. Pirate Taco? These are all possible match-ups, plus thousands more.

186946.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XVIII
186946.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XVIII, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 23 mythic spells, from sculpt sound to slay living. A mythic secure shelter is not only larger, more comfortable, and far more secure, but can also be made to grow legs and move about at the caster’s command. A mythic sepia snake sigil is far more persistent than the non-mythic version, and can be used to also poison the victim, to be reusable after being triggered, or even to hold victims in suspended animation indefinitely. Mythic shadow conjuration and shadow evocation can replicate the effects of mythic spells (even if you don’t know the mythic versions of those spells), while mythic shrink item can miniaturize even entire buildings and other structures, shrinking all the creatures inside along with them. This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

186947.description:
THE STORY
You might be a bounty hunter looking for fame and fortune. You might be a peasant looking to feed his starving family. You might be a maiden running away from her arranged marriage, or just a random dude who has gotten lost. Whoever you are, you’ve ended up at The Grimwood, a forest where supernatural creatures reside.

THE GAME
This highly chaotic, slightly strategic game for 2-6 players takes you into the dark fantasy of The Grimwood, where you search the forest (i.e., deck) to find settings, animals, or most coveted of all, supernaturals, to add to your collection. Use the powers of the supernaturals to help yourself or sabotage others, or find a Rune or Amulet for extra actions or protection. Lots of things can happen in The Grimwood. Find—and keep—the most combinations, and you win!



In The Grimwood, a player's turn consists of:
1. Drawing 1 card from the deck or Stealing 1 card from another player's hand.2. Playing a supernatural's power or a Rune.

3. Placing a combo.

There are 3 types of combos: Animal, Setting, or Supernatural combos. They are worth the following points:

Animal Combos
3 Owls = 10 points
3 Crows = 10 points

Setting Combos
1 Clearing + 1 Path + 1 Swamp = 5 points
3 clearings or 3 swamps or 3 paths = 3 points

Supernatural Combos
1 Supernatural = 1 point
2 Supernaturals = 2 points
3 Supernaturals = 5 points
4 Supernaturals = 10 points
5 Supernaturals = 15 points

The game ends when the last card is drawn. The deck goes quicker than you think!
186947.name: The Grimwood

186948.name: Prestige Classes and Rune Magic
186948.description:
From Introduction:

Many of the character concepts that were once prestige classes or paragon paths in earlier editions of D&D are now options available to 1st-level characters.

As such, prestige classes build on the game’s broad range of basic options to represent specialized options and unique training. The first of those specialized options for fifth edition D&D is the rune scribe — a character who masters ancient sigils that embody the fundamental magic of creation.

186950.description:
Mad Mansion is a competitive tile-laying game for two players, ages 10 and up, that plays in around 30 minutes.
In the game, each player represents a team of 8 Workers. During the game, players place between one to three tiles per turn to build Hallways, Rooms, and groups of linked rooms called Suites to create an overhead map of the mansion. The Workers who successfully build and complete the most Rooms in the Mansion will win the game! To score points, players place Workers on the tiles they build to claim Rooms and Suites that are Under Construction. At the end of the game, points are scored for the total number of Rooms claimed by each player... one point each for Rooms that are Under Construction, and two points each for Rooms that have been Completed (meaning that every door in the Room or Suite is connected to a hallway, or all of the rooms are bounded by solid walls.) When all of the available tiles in the game have been placed the game is over and the player with the highest number of points wins.
Every game is a unique experience as no two Mansion layouts are ever the same.
186950.name: Mad Mansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: 17. Devon Dice podcast Room Escaping, Surfing, Murder, space surviving and Klask...

186952.name: Elastrix
186952.description:
Bounce your way to victory!
Elastrix is a puzzle game that will stretch your brain to the max! The rules are simple: stretch elastics onto pegs, bounce little Trix creatures on them, and hit the targets.

But easier said than done! Throw in challenge gems to collect, new zany kinds of elastics, moving obstacles, anti-gravity, and a quest to make the Perfect Shot - and suddenly it's an hour later and you've forgotten to make supper.

Oh yes, it's that kind of game.

Source: The Game Website.

186953.name: Lascaux
rpgseries: 2015 Virtuacon One Page RPG & Character Sheet RPGs
186953.description:
From the introduction:

There are over 2,000 figures illustrated in the caves of Lascaux. Of the ~600 identified animal paintings in Lascaux, over half are equines, with another 90 stags. Others include aurochs and bison, some lions, and one each of a bird, a bear and a rhinoceros.

There are no paintings of reindeer, even though archaeologists have determined that reindeer made up the principle meat eaten by the people at the time.

There is no aesthetic reason not to depict reindeer – they are beautiful animals. Therefore their absence must be attributed to religion.

An artist’s soul of itself does not limit what can be depicted. This limitation must be imposed by an external religion. This game explores the conflict between art and religion, as well as other challenges of life in the Paleolithic.

186954.name: Odd World
186954.description: Odd World immerses players in a game universe where collecting the most planets is the path to victory. There is however one condition, only an odd number of each of the known planets will count towards victory. To win, players take calculated risks, watch their opponents' game and attempt to cunningly disrupt it all the while trying to preserve their own gains. Remain on guard as tumbling from what seems as a sure winning position to a losing one can happen with the flip of a card!

boardgamecompilation: Exodus: Edge of Extinction – Kickstarter Limited Components
186955.description:
Exodus: Edge of Extinction is the first expansion of Exodus: Proxima Centauri (revised edition). The printing of this expansion, along with a reprint of the base game itself, was successfully funded via Kickstarter.

The original Exodus: Proxima Centauri was a distinguishable entry among other 4X games of the new wave, leaving its unique mark on the gaming world. With a game play focused on high-octane conflict fueled by raging war and cutthroat politics, it also introduced players to a rich science fiction setting, with its own back story and its own secrets. Exodus: Edge of Extinction expands both the gaming and the narrative aspect of Exodus: Proxima Centauri into an even more epic space strategy empire building game.

Exodus: Edge of Extinction represents the next chapter of an immersive story in which the remnants of humanity go to war against each other over a system they believe to be Proxima Centauri. Each player leads one of six unique factions with their own histories, strengths, unique special abilities and a set of new, exclusive technologies.

Exodus: Edge of Extinction also brings larger fleets, custom action cards and completely new mechanisms like the Combat Cards, adding a whole new layer to the spectrum of strategies already available in the base game.

The Kickstarter edition of Exodus: Edge of Extinction differs from the retail edition in that it contains the Exodus: Edge of Extinction – Kickstarter Limited Components, which further enhances the content introduced in this expansion by adding more faction specific Action Cards, additional Combat Cards and Political Cards, along with more scenarios for solo play.

Some Kickstarter backers received the Kickstarter Limited Components inside the expansion box, whereas others received the extras packaged separately. In all cases, however, the box itself for the Kickstarter edition is identical to the retail edition. The only way to tell if it is a Kickstarter edition or not is by examining the contents. In addition, these extras are available separately. None are Kickstarter-exclusive.
186955.name: Exodus: Edge of Extinction – Kickstarter Edition

186956.name: Think Big Science
186956.description:
From the publisher:
Climb the tower to conquer the big ideas of science! Unique 3–D game board combines with important core–concept questions for a game that's exciting and educational.

Reinforces key "big idea" science concepts, content vocabulary, data and graph interpretation, and life science topics with engaging game questions

Offers opportunities to review and integrate concepts as players answer questions to climb the tower until they reach the top–level core concept question for the win

Focuses on specific content with color–coded, standards–based questions on animals, plants, life cycles, food chains, human body and more

Engages students with eye–catching graphics and game cards that feature photos, graphs, charts and diagrams

Helps students become comfortable with standardized test–style short answer and multiple choice questions

Includes 200 double–sided question cards in a storage box and an easy–to–assemble game tower measuring 3.5" in diameter at the bottom x 10.75"H

Grades 3–5

How to Play:

Answer questions correctly to race around each level
Three correct answers move player up a level
First player to correctly answer the top–level "big idea question" wins!

186957.name: Wild Word Adventure
186957.description:
Product Description:
Motivate beginning readers to build 3, 4 and even 5 letter words! Reinforces letter recognition, beginning and ending consonant sounds, rhyming and spelling. Color coded for 3 levels of play.

Includes:


80 self-checking question cards
104 lowercase letter cards
25 word cards
Animal pawns
Game board


Grades: Kindergarten +

How to play:

Pick a word card, then roll the die and hop around the board.
To earn a letter, correctly answer the question that matches the color you land on.
Be the first to match up all letters to those on your word card to win!

186958.name: Hidden Hints
186958.description:
From the publisher:

Wrangle your way through word-sleuthing adventures to earn a shot at solving a mystery.

Challenges kids to figure out what words mean by clues in the text around them

Broadens vocabulary through engaging, mystery-themed game play

Includes 43 double-sided, multiple-choice question cards; 7 double-sided game play cards, 40 self-checking hint cards, 16 game pieces, briefcase, and Activity Guide with answer key

Durable cardboard briefcase measures 5"L x 7"W x 1.5"H

How to play:

Select a hint card and place it in the briefcase—don’t peek!
Draw a context clue card and answer the question.
Answer 3 questions correctly to earn a hint about your mystery object.
Be the first to solve your mystery, and win!

186959.name: Healthy Helpings
186959.description:
From the publisher:
Be the first to fill your plate with a balanced meal! Follow the USDA’s MyPlate guidelines. Food cards have real-life photos and are self-checking (the back of the photo matches the food group it belongs in)

Includes:

50 food cards
4 placemats
1 spinner
Activity guide




Learning Style: Visual

Skill development:
Self-Help- Provides a visual tool to help students understand portion control according to the five food groups when filling their plate at meal time.

Social & Behavioral- Real-life photo cards help students learn to make nutritional choices when having a snack or making a meal based on the five food groups.

Basic Concepts- Promotes identification of the 5 food groups- fruits, vegetables, grains, protein and dairy. By learning the food groups, students are creating building blocks for maintaining a healthy diet.

How to play:

Spin the spinner to select a food group.
Pick a food card that matches the group.
The first player with a complete, balanced MyPlate wins!

186960.name: tri-FACTa
186960.description:
From the publisher:
Make addition and subtraction 3 times as fun! Dish out the numbered playing cards, then using the familiar triangle board as a visual cue, fill in the missing spots to complete fact families. Be the first player to play all your cards, and call out “tri-FACTa"!
Includes triangle game board, 100 cards (facts up to 20) and 4 trays

Object of the game:
Be the first player to play all your cards, and call out "tri-FACTa!"

186961.description:
On the coast of California lies the most exciting city in America. In this place aliens rub shoulders with ancient gods. Robots join forces with those born with strange powers and fantastic abilities. It’s a place filled with heroes and villains, where everyday men and women live side by side with Supremes.

This is Pulp City. Pulp City is playground where all your favorite 80’s action movies, comic books, and cartoons collide. It’s a setting perfect for crazy battles and thrilling heroics. Dastardly villain and large than life heroes are all part and parcel. So if you love any of the above or all of it together you should be in Pulp City.

Pulp City is a heroic 32mm skirmish game where you the player take control of a Team of Supremes and lead them into battle against rival Teams. Pulp City allows you to live out your favorite action movie moments, destroying buildings, throwing cars, saving the innocent, or just pummeling others into the ground.
186961.name: Pulp City: Supreme Edition

186962.name: Paul's Poker RPG
186962.description:
User summary:

Paul's Poker RPG is a generic, universal RPG mechanism that can resolve a variety of actions by using a standard deck of playing cards and "poker" mechanics.

Characters get fifteen Abilities. The game describes several but notes that characters can select any Abilities they want; they are just a narrative tag describing an Ability that the character has. Attributes may be General, Specific, or Exact. While General Abilities offer a wide range of capability, Specific and Exact Abilities grant a discard bonus (see below). Samples General Abilities are: melee combat, ranged combat, dodging. Sample Specific Abilities are: melee combat - swords, ranged combat - guns, dodging - ranged weapons. Sample Exact Abilities are: melee combat - katana, ranged combat - M16, dodging: bullets. Characters assign a number of "cards" to each ability from an ability array of 5, 4, 4, 3, 3, 3, 2, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, and 1.

Damage and health are narrative and proceed through several stages from Uninjured to Dead with five injury levels in between. Characters gain experience and can spend the experience by gaining another "card" on an existing ability or by gaining a new "one card" ability.

When a character attempts a non-trivial action the player draws a hand of five cards and then plays the number of cards indicated by the relevant Ability's "card" score (1 through 5). If the score is above five (or if the Attribute is Specific or Exact) the character may perform a discard and draw, as is done in draw poker, to attempt a better hand. The player creates the best poker hand they can by using up to the "card" score of the ability and then plays the hand.

In an uncontested action, the player must beat:

Average Difficulty: better than an Ace
Difficult: better than a pair of Aces
Very Difficult: better than three Aces




In a contested action, the two opponents compare hands and, per poker rules, the best hand succeeds and the other hand fails.

The game refers to Wikipedia's entry on poker hands.

186963.name: PCSIK Core Module
186963.description:
From the introduction:

The PCSIK Core Module defines the fundamental components of the PCSIK system. It details how characters are defined, without defining the characters for you. It explains the basic elements of game play, all the while allowing you to select which components of the system you want. It also includes a brief description of common genres, along with hints and suggestions of incorporating common themes into your games.

The Core Module does not contain any specific details beyond the examples. The actual content of the system is left to the group to define, as they need. Characters are created from the concept upwards, and theme overrides rules.

186964.name: Etherlords II Creatures
186964.description:
User summary:

Etherlords II Creatures is a supplement built using the PCSIK Core Module. It contains about 150 "monsters" for use in the game. Each entry has a name and a cumulative point-build cost, Attributes, and Abilities. A point-build cost breakdown is given for every item in the build. The peculiar title is derived from a campaign run by the author. The supplement is not illustrated.

186965.name: Etherlords II Spells
186965.description:
User summary:

Etherlords II Spells is a supplement built using the PCSIK Core Module. It contains two schools of magic ("Green Magic of Vitality" and "Red Magic of Chaos") and one summoning spell within each school. Both spells detail a number of "monsters" that can be summoned, with their point-build cost.

The peculiar title is derived from a campaign run by the author. The supplement is not illustrated.

186966.name: Warcraft III Prestige Classes
186966.description:
User summary:

Warcraft III Prestige Classes takes the concepts for character builds from the Blizzard Entertainment's Warcraft III Computer Game and presents them as Prestige Classes for the D20 OGL. The Prestige Classes presented include:


Archmage - an impressive magic user
Beastmater - a powerful master of the wild
Blademaster - an elite Orcish warrior
Blood Mage - a crazed elf spellcaster
Crypt Lord - an immortal warrior
Dark Ranger - a twisted ranger
Death Knight - a possessed and brutal warrior
Demon Hunter - a dangerous Night Elf warrior
Dread Lord - demonic overlords
Far Seer - shamanic Orc leaders
Firelord - a hateful master of arcane arts
Goblin Alchemist - a goblin alchemist
Goblin Tinker - a goblin tinker
Keeper of the Grove - an ancient protector of the lands
Lich - an undying spellcaster
Mountain King - an elite Dwarven fighter
Naga Sea Witch - a mutated Night Elf spellcaster
Paladin of the Silver Hand - the last bastion of hope
Pandaren Brewmaster - a wandering warrior and brewer
Pit Lord - a demonic warrior
Priestess of the Moon - a Night Elf spiritual leader
Shadow Hunter - a Troll spellcaster
Tauren Chieftain - a leader of a Tauren tribe
Warden - a night elf guard

186967.name: SGMS Spycraft
186967.description:
User summary:

This supplement for the Spycraft game fuses the basic rules with a setting derived from the card game Super Giant Monster Showdown. In the setting presented, the players run characters who protect the world from the depredations of Giant Monsters. Much of the game revolves around tracking the monsters to discover their lairs. Along the way, characters will encounter aliens, dimensional rifts, riots, WMDs, and other dangers.

186968.name: The Legend of Zelda D20
186968.description:
From the introduction:

This book was designed to bring players and Game Master’s alike into the world of the Legend of Zelda without having to write volumes of optional rules themselves. In addition, the source material collected within was researched from dozens of sources, and we have made every possible attempt to stick as closely to the canon of the Legend of Zelda material as possible.

User summary:

This impressive and high-quality supplement adapts Nintendo's Legend of Zelda series to the D20 OGL system. It includes chapters on: the setting; the tribes; classes; performances, feats, and skills; character details; magic of the Tri-Force (with Aspect spell lists); prestige classes; monsters; and a gazetteer. All aspects of the document are geared toward an immersive D20 experience in the world of Zelda.

186969.name: The Star Adventure
186969.description:
Little stars have fallen from the sky, into the players' room. Help them get back to the sky, to their mother!

A game designed for children as young as 3. Players alternate in throwing the color-coded dice and stepping up the star-ladder.

186970.name: Stigmat
186970.description:
User Summary
